56:10 In God the Lord, whose word I praise, in God I trust and will not be afraid, for what can mortals do to me?
56:11 I am bound by the vows I made to you, O God; I will present to you thank-offerings.
56:12 For you have rescued my soul from death and my feet from stumbling, that I may walk before God in the light of the living.

57:1 Be merciful to me, O God, be merciful, for I have taken refuge in you; in the shadow of your wings will I take refuge until this time of trouble has passed.
57:2 I will call upon the Most High God, the God who maintains my cause.
57:3 He will send from heaven and save me; he will confound those who trample upon me; God will send forth his love and his faithfulness.
57:4 I lie in the midst of lions that devour the people; their teeth are spears and arrows, their tongue a sharp sword.
57:5 Be exalted, O God, above the heavens; let your glory be over all the earth.
57:6 They have laid a net for my feet, and I am bowed low; they have dug a pit before me, but have fallen into it themselves.
57:7 My heart is firmly fixed, O God, my heart is fixed; I will sing and make melody.
57:8 Wake up, my spirit; awake, lute and harp; I myself will waken the dawn.
57:9 I will confess you among the peoples, O Lord; I will sing praise to you among the nations.
57:10 For your loving-kindness is greater than the heavens, and your faithfulness reaches to the clouds.
57:11 Be exalted, O God, above the heavens; let your glory be over all the earth.

58:1 Do you indeed speak justly in council? do you judge with equity, you mortals?
58:2 No, in your mind you devise wickedness, and your hands deal out violence in the land.
58:3 The wicked are estranged from the womb; they have gone astray from their birth and speak lies.
58:4 Their poison is like the poison of a serpent; they are like the deaf adder that stops its ears,
58:5 Which does not heed the voice of the charmer, no matter how skillful his charming.
58:6 O God, break their teeth in their mouths; pull the fangs of the young lions, O Lord.
58:7 Let them vanish like water that runs off; let them wither like trodden grass.
58:8 Let them be like the snail that melts away, like a dead-born child that never sees the sun.
58:9 Before they bear fruit, let them be cut down like a brier; let them be swept away like the thorns of a desert.
58:10 The righteous shall rejoice when they see the vengeance; they shall wash their feet in the blood of the wicked.
58:11 And people shall say, 'Surely there is a reward for the righteous; surely there is a God who rules in the earth.'

59:1 Deliver me from my enemies, O my God; protect me from those who rise up against me.
59:2 Deliver me from those who work evil; from the bloodthirsty save me.
59:3 Even now they lie in wait for my life; the mighty stir up strife against me. For no transgression or sin of mine, O Lord,
59:4 for no fault of mine, they run and make ready. Rouse yourself, come to my help and see!
59:5 You, Lord God of hosts, are God of Israel. Awake to punish all the nations; spare none of those who treacherously plot evil. Selah
59:6 They come each evening howling like dogs and prowl about the city.
59:7 See, they spew with their mouths, with swords in their lipsâ€”for 'Who,' they think, 'will hear us?'
59:8 But you, O Lord, laugh at them; you hold all the nations in derision.
59:9 O my strength, I will watch for you; for you, O God, are my fortress.
59:10 My God in his steadfast love will meet me; my God will let me look in triumph on my enemies.
59:11 Do not kill them, lest my people forget; scatter them by your power, and bring them down, O Lord, our shield.
59:12 For the sin of their mouths, the words of their lips, let them be trapped in their pride. For the cursing and lies that they utter,
59:13 consume them in wrath; consume them until they are no more, so that they may know that God rules over Jacob to the ends of the earth. Selah
59:14 Each evening they come howling like dogs and prowl about the city.
59:15 They roam about for food, and growl if they do not get their fill.
59:16 But I will sing of your might; I will sing aloud of your steadfast love in the morning. For you have been a fortress for me and a refuge in the day of my distress.
59:17 O my strength, I will sing praises to you, for you, O God, are my fortress, the God who shows me steadfast love.

60:1 O God, you have rejected us, broken our defenses; you have been angry; now restore us!
60:2 You have caused the land to quake; you have torn it open; repair the cracks in it, for it is tottering.
60:3 You have made your people suffer hard things; you have given us wine to drink that makes us reel.
60:4 You have set up a banner for those who fear you, to rally to it from the bow. Selah
60:5 Give victory with your right hand, and answer us, so that those whom you love may be rescued.
60:6 God has spoken in his sanctuary: 'With exultation I will divide up Shechem, and portion out the Vale of Succoth.
60:7 Gilead is mine, and Manasseh is mine; Ephraim is my helmet; Judah is my scepter.
60:8 Moab is my washbasin; on Edom I hurl my shoe; over Philistia I shout in triumph.'
60:9 Who will bring me to the fortified city? Who will lead me to Edom?
60:10 Have you not rejected us, O God? You do not go out, O God, with our armies.
60:11 O grant us help against the foe, for human help is worthless.
60:12 With God we shall do valiantly; it is he who will tread down our foes.

61:1 Hear my cry, O God; listen to my prayer.
61:2 From the end of the earth I call to you, when my heart is faint. Lead me to the rock that is higher than I;
61:3 for you are my refuge, a strong tower against the enemy.
61:4 Let me abide in your tent forever, find refuge under the shelter of your wings. Selah
61:5 For you, O God, have heard my vows; you have given me the heritage of those who fear your name.
61:6 Prolong the life of the king; may his years endure to all generations!
61:7 May he be enthroned in the presence of God forever; appoint steadfast love and faithfulness to watch over him!
61:8 So I will always sing praises to your name, as I pay my vows day after day.

62:1 For God alone my soul in silence waits; from him comes my salvation.
62:2 He alone is my rock and my salvation, my stronghold, so that I shall not be greatly shaken.
62:3 How long will you assail me to crush me, all of you together, as if you were a leaning wall, a tottering fence?
62:4 Their only plan is to bring me down from my height; they delight in lies; they bless with their mouth, but inwardly they curse.
62:5 For God alone my soul in silence waits; truly, my hope is in him.
62:6 He alone is my rock and my salvation, my stronghold, so that I shall not be shaken.
62:7 In God is my safety and my honor; God is my strong rock and my refuge.
62:8 Put your trust in him always, O people, pour out your hearts before him, for God is our refuge.
62:9 Those of high degree are but a fleeting breath, even those of low estate cannot be trusted.
62:10 On the scales they are lighter than a puff of wind, all of them together.
62:11 Put no trust in extortion; in robbery take no empty pride; though wealth increase, set not your heart upon it.
62:12 God has spoken once, twice have I heard it, that power belongs to God.
62:13 Steadfast love is yours, O Lord, for you repay everyone according to his deeds.

63:1 O God, you are my God; eagerly I seek you; my soul thirsts for you, my flesh faints for you, as in a barren and dry land where there is no water.
63:2 Therefore I have gazed upon you in your holy place, that I might behold your power and your glory.
63:3 For your loving-kindness is better than life itself; my lips shall give you praise.
63:4 So will I bless you as long as I live and lift up my hands in your Name.
63:5 My soul is content, as with marrow and fatness, and my mouth praises you with joyful lips,
63:6 When I remember you upon my bed and meditate on you in the night watches.
63:7 For you have been my helper, and under the shadow of your wings I will rejoice.
63:8 My soul clings to you; your right hand holds me fast.
63:9 May those who seek my life to destroy it go down into the depths of the earth;
63:10 Let them fall by the edge of the sword, and let them be food for jackals.
63:11 But the king shall rejoice in God; all those who swear by him shall be glad, for the mouth of those who speak lies shall be stopped.

64:1 Hear my voice, O God, in my complaint; guard my life from fear of the enemy.
64:2 Hide me from the conspiracy of the wicked, from the gathering of evildoers;
64:3 They sharpen their tongue like a sword and aim their bitter words like arrows;
64:4 That they may shoot at the innocent from ambush; they shoot suddenly and do not fear.
64:5 They hold fast to their evil course; they plan how they may hide their snares; they say, 'Who will see us?'
64:6 They search out wickedness and lay a cunning trap; for deep are the inward thoughts and hearts of them all.
64:7 But God will shoot at them with his swift arrow, and suddenly they shall be wounded.
64:8 Their own tongues shall make them fall, and all who see them shall shake their heads.
64:9 Everyone shall stand in awe and declare God's deeds; they shall consider his handiwork.
64:10 The righteous shall rejoice in the Lord and put their trust in him, and all who are true of heart shall glory.

65:1 Praise is due to you, O God, in Zion; and to you shall vows be performed.
65:2 O you who answer prayer! To you all flesh shall come.
65:3 When deeds of iniquity overwhelm us, you forgive our transgressions.
65:4 Happy are those whom you choose and bring near to live in your courts. We shall be satisfied with the goodness of your house, your holy temple.
65:5 By awesome deeds you answer us with deliverance, O God of our salvation; you are the hope of all the ends of the earth and of the farthest seas.
65:6 By your strength you established the mountains; you are girded with power.
65:7 You silence the roaring of the seas, the roaring of their waves, the tumult of the peoples.
65:8 Those who live at earth's farthest bounds are awed by your signs; you make the morning and the evening shout for joy.
65:9 You visit the earth and water it, you greatly enrich it; the river of God is full of water; you provide the people with grain, for so you have prepared it.
65:10 You water its furrows abundantly, settling its ridges, softening it with showers, and blessing its growth.
65:11 You crown the year with your bounty; your wagon tracks overflow with richness.
65:12 The pastures of the wilderness overflow, the hills gird themselves with joy,
65:13 the meadows clothe themselves with flocks, the valleys deck themselves with grain, they shout and sing together for joy.

66:1 Make a joyful noise to God, all the earth;
66:2 sing the glory of his name; give to him glorious praise.
66:3 Say to God, 'How awesome are your deeds! Because of your great power, your enemies cringe before you.
66:4 All the earth worships you; they sing praises to you, sing praises to your name.' Selah
66:5 Come and see what God has done: he is awesome in his deeds among mortals.
66:6 He turned the sea into dry land; they passed through the river on foot. There we rejoiced in him,
66:7 who rules by his might forever, whose eyes keep watch on the nationsâ€” let the rebellious not exalt themselves. Selah
66:8 Bless our God, O peoples, let the sound of his praise be heard,
66:9 who has kept our soul among the living, and has not let our feet slip.
66:10 For you, O God, have tested us; you have tried us as silver is tried.
66:11 You brought us into the net; you laid burdens on our backs;
66:12 you let people ride over our heads; we went through fire and through water; yet you have brought us out to a spacious place.

67:1 May God be gracious to us and bless us and make his face to shine upon us, Selah
67:2 that your way may be known upon earth, your saving power among all nations.
67:3 Let the peoples praise you, O God; let all the peoples praise you.
67:4 Let the nations be glad and sing for joy, for you judge the peoples with equity and guide the nations upon earth. Selah
67:5 Let the peoples praise you, O God; let all the peoples praise you.
67:6 The earth has yielded its increase; God, our God, has blessed us.
67:7 May God continue to bless us; let all the ends of the earth revere him.

68:1 Let God arise, and let his enemies be scattered; let those who hate him flee before him.
68:2 Let them vanish like smoke when the wind drives it away; as the wax melts at the fire, so let the wicked perish at the presence of God.
68:3 But let the righteous be glad and rejoice before God; let them also be merry and joyful.
68:4 Sing to God, sing praises to his Name; exalt him who rides upon the heavens; YAHWEH is his Name, rejoice before him!
68:5 Father of orphans, defender of widows, God in his holy habitation!
68:6 God gives the solitary a home and brings forth prisoners into freedom; but the rebellious live in a dry land.
68:7 O God, when you went forth before your people, when you marched through the wilderness,
68:8 The earth shook, and the skies poured down rain, at the presence of God, the God of Sinai, at the presence of God, the God of Israel.
68:9 You sent a gracious rain, O God, upon your inheritance; you refreshed the land when it was weary.
68:10 Your people found their home in it; in your goodness, O God, you have made provision for the poor.
68:11 The Lord gave the word; great was the company of women who bore the tidings:
68:12 'Kings with their armies are fleeing away; the women at home are dividing the spoil.'
68:13 Though you lingered among the sheepfolds, you shall be like a dove whose wings are covered with silver, whose feathers are like green gold.
68:14 When the Almighty scattered kings, it was like snow falling in Zalmon.
68:15 O mighty mountain, O hill of Bashan! O rugged mountain, O hill of Bashan!
68:16 Why do you look with envy, O rugged mountain, at the hill which God chose for his resting place? truly, the Lord will dwell there for ever.
68:17 The chariots of God are twenty thousand, even thousands of thousands; the Lord comes in holiness from Sinai.
68:18 You have gone up on high and led captivity captive; you have received gifts even from your enemies, that the Lord God might dwell among them.
68:19 Blessed be the Lord day by day, the God of our salvation, who bears our burdens.
68:20 He is our God, the God of our deliverance; God is the Lord, by whom we escape death.
68:21 God will smite the head of his enemies, the hairy scalp of those who go on still in their wickedness.
68:22 The Lord has said, 'I will bring them back from Bashan; I will bring them back from the depths of the sea;
68:23 That your foot may be dipped in blood, the tongue of your dogs in the blood of your enemies.'
68:24 They see your procession, O God, your procession into the sanctuary, my God and my King.
68:25 The singers go before, the musicians follow after, in the midst of maidens playing upon the timbrels.
68:26 'Bless God in the congregation; bless the Lord, you that are of the fountain of Israel.'
68:27 There is Benjamin, least of the tribes, at the head; the princes of Judah in a great company, the princes of Zebulun and Naphtali.
68:28 Send forth your strength, O God; establish, O God, what you have wrought for us.
68:29 For your temple's sake in Jerusalem kings shall bring gifts to you.
68:30 Rebuke the wild beast of the reeds, and the peoples, a herd of wild bulls with their calves.
68:31 Trample down those who lust after silver; scatter the peoples that delight in war.
68:32 Let prosperity come out of Egypt; let Ethiopia stretch out her hands to God.
68:33 Sing to God, O kingdoms of the earth; sing praises to the Lord.
68:34 He rides in the heavens, the ancient heavens; he sends forth his voice, his mighty voice.
68:35 Ascribe power to God; his majesty is over Israel; his dominion is in the skies.
68:36 How wonderful is God in his holy places! the God of Israel giving strength and power to his people! Blessed be God!

69:1 Save me, O God, for the waters have risen up to my neck.
69:2 I am sinking in deep mire, and there is no firm ground for my feet.
69:3 I have come into deep waters, and the torrent washes over me.
69:4 I have grown weary with my crying; my throat is inflamed; my eyes have failed from looking for my God.
69:5 Those who hate me without a cause are more than the hairs of my head; my lying foes who would destroy me are mighty. Must I then give back what I never stole?
69:6 O God, you know my foolishness, and my faults are not hidden from you.
69:7 Let not those who trust in you be ashamed through me, Lord God of hosts; let not those who seek you be disgraced because of me, O God of Israel.
69:8 Surely, for your sake have I suffered reproach, and shame has covered my face.
69:9 I have become a stranger to my own kindred, an alien to my mother's children.
69:10 Zeal for your house has eaten me up; the scorn of those who scorn you has fallen upon me.
69:11 I humbled myself with fasting, but that was turned to my reproach.
69:12 I put on sack-cloth also, and became a byword among them.
69:13 Those who sit at the gate murmur against me, and the drunkards make songs about me.
69:14 But as for me, this is my prayer to you, at the time you have set, O Lord:
69:15 'In your great mercy, O God, answer me with your unfailing help.
69:16 Save me from the mire; do not let me sink; let me be rescued from those who hate me and out of the deep waters.
69:17 Let not the torrent of waters wash over me, neither let the deep swallow me up; do not let the Pit shut its mouth upon me.
69:18 Answer me, O Lord, for your love is kind; in your great compassion, turn to me.'
69:19 'Hide not your face from your servant; be swift and answer me, for I am in distress.
69:20 Draw near to me and redeem me; because of my enemies deliver me.
69:21 You know my reproach, my shame, and my dishonor; my adversaries are all in your sight.'
69:22 Reproach has broken my heart, and it cannot be healed; I looked for sympathy, but there was none, for comforters, but I could find no one.
69:23 They gave me gall to eat, and when I was thirsty, they gave me vinegar to drink.
69:24 Let the table before them be a trap and their sacred feasts a snare.
69:25 Let their eyes be darkened, that they cannot see, and make their loins tremble continually.
69:26 Pour out your indignation upon them, and let the fierceness of your anger overtake them.
69:27 Let their camp be desolate, and let there be none to dwell in their tents.
69:28 For they persecute him whom you have stricken and add to the pain of those whom you have pierced.
69:29 Lay to their charge guilt upon guilt, and let them not receive your vindication.
69:30 Let them be wiped out of the book of the living and not be written among the righteous.
69:31 As for me, I am afflicted and in pain; your help, O God, will lift me up on high.
69:32 I will praise the Name of God in song; I will proclaim his greatness with thanksgiving.
69:33 This will please the Lord more than an offering of oxen, more than bullocks with horns and hoofs.
69:34 The afflicted shall see and be glad; you who seek God, your heart shall live.
69:35 For the Lord listens to the needy, and his prisoners he does not despise.
69:36 Let the heavens and the earth praise him, the seas and all that moves in them;
69:37 For God will save Zion and rebuild the cities of Judah; so that they may dwell there and have it in possession.
69:38 The children of his servants will inherit it, and those who love his Name will dwell therein.

70:1 Be pleased, O God, to deliver me; O Lord, make haste to help me.
70:2 Let those who seek my life be ashamed and altogether dismayed; let those who take pleasure in my misfortune draw back and be disgraced.
70:3 Let those who say to me 'Aha!' and gloat over me turn back, because they are ashamed.
70:4 Let all who seek you rejoice and be glad in you; let those who love your salvation say for ever, 'Great is the Lord!'
70:5 But as for me, I am poor and needy; come to me speedily, O God.
70:6 You are my helper and my deliverer; O Lord, do not tarry.

71:1 In you, O Lord, have I taken refuge; let me never be ashamed.
71:2 In your righteousness, deliver me and set me free; incline your ear to me and save me.
71:3 Be my strong rock, a castle to keep me safe; you are my crag and my stronghold.
71:4 Deliver me, my God, from the hand of the wicked, from the clutches of the evildoer and the oppressor.
71:5 For you are my hope, O Lord God, my confidence since I was young.
71:6 I have been sustained by you ever since I was born; from my mother's womb you have been my strength; my praise shall be always of you.
71:7 I have become a portent to many; but you are my refuge and my strength.
71:8 Let my mouth be full of your praise and your glory all the day long.
71:9 Do not cast me off in my old age; forsake me not when my strength fails.
71:10 For my enemies are talking against me, and those who lie in wait for my life take counsel together.
71:11 They say, 'God has forsaken him; go after him and seize him; because there is none who will save.'
71:12 O God, be not far from me; come quickly to help me, my God.
71:13 Let those who set themselves against me be put to shame and perish; let those who seek to do me evil be covered with scorn and reproach.
71:14 But I shall always wait in patience, and shall praise you more and more.
71:15 My mouth shall tell of your righteousness and salvation all the day long, for I know no end of them.
71:16 I will begin with the mighty works of the Lord God; I will recall your righteousness, yours alone.
71:17 O God, you have taught me since I was young, and to this day I tell of your wonderful works.
71:18 And now that I am old and gray-headed, O God, do not forsake me, till I make known your strength to this generation and your power to all who are to come.
71:19 Your righteousness, O God, reaches to the heavens; you have done great things; who is like you, O God?
71:20 You have showed me great troubles and adversities, but you will restore my life and bring me up again from the deep places of the earth.
71:21 You will strengthen my honor and comfort me all around.
71:22 Therefore I will praise you upon the lyre for your faithfulness, O my God; I will sing to you with the harp, O Holy One of Israel.
71:23 My lips will shout for joy when I sing to you, and my soul, which you have redeemed.
71:24 My tongue will tell of your righteous deeds all the day long, for those who sought to do me evil have been confounded and put to shame.

72:1 Give the King your justice, O God, and your righteousness to the King's Son;
72:2 That he may rule your people righteously and the poor with justice.
72:3 That the mountains may bring prosperity to the people, and the little hills, a righteous reward.
72:4 He shall defend the needy among the people; he shall rescue the poor and crush the oppressor.
72:5 He shall live as long as the sun and moon endure, from one generation to another.
72:6 He shall come down like rain upon the mown field, like showers that water the earth.
72:7 In his time shall the righteous flourish; there shall be abundance of peace till the moon shall be no more.
72:8 He shall rule from sea to sea, and from the River to the ends of the earth.
72:9 His foes shall bow down before him, and his enemies lick the dust.
72:10 The kings of Tarshish and of the isles shall pay tribute, and the kings of Arabia and Saba offer gifts.
72:11 All kings shall bow down before him, and all the nations do him service.
72:12 For he shall deliver the poor who cries out in distress, and the oppressed who has no helper.
72:13 He shall have pity on the lowly and poor; he shall preserve the lives of the needy.
72:14 He shall redeem their lives from oppression and violence, and dear shall their blood be in his sight.
72:15 Long may he live! and may there be given to him gold from Arabia; may prayer be made for him always, and may they bless him all the day long.
72:16 May there be abundance of grain on the earth, growing thick even on the hilltops; may its fruit flourish like Lebanon, and its grain like grass upon the earth.
72:17 May his Name remain for ever and be established as long as the sun endures; may all the nations bless themselves in him and call him blessed.
72:18 Blessed be the Lord God, the God of Israel, who alone does wondrous deeds!
72:19 And blessed be his glorious Name for ever! and may all the earth be filled with his glory. Amen. Amen.

73:1 Truly, God is good to Israel, to those who are pure in heart.
73:2 But as for me, my feet had nearly slipped; I had almost tripped and fallen;
73:3 Because I envied the proud and saw the prosperity of the wicked:
73:4 For they suffer no pain, and their bodies are sleek and sound;
73:5 In the misfortunes of others they have no share; they are not afflicted as others are;
73:6 They wear their pride like a necklace and wrap their violence about them like a cloak.
73:7 Their iniquity comes from gross minds, and their hearts overflow with wicked thoughts.
73:8 They scoff and speak maliciously; out of their haughtiness they plan oppression.
73:9 They set their mouths against the heavens, and their evil speech runs through the world.
73:10 And so the people turn to them and find in them no fault.
73:11 They say, 'How should God know? is there knowledge in the Most High?'
73:12 So then, these are the wicked; always at ease, they increase their wealth.
73:13 In vain have I kept my heart clean, and washed my hands in innocence.
73:14 I have been afflicted all day long, and punished every morning.
73:15 Indeed, if I had spoken as they do, I would have betrayed the generation of your children.
73:16 When I tried to understand these things, it was too hard for me;
73:17 Until I entered the sanctuary of God and discerned the end of the wicked.
73:18 Surely, you set them in slippery places; you cast them down in ruin.
73:19 Oh, how suddenly do they come to destruction, come to an end, and perish from terror!
73:20 Like a dream when one awakens, O Lord, when you arise you will make their image vanish.
73:21 When my mind became embittered, I was sorely wounded in my heart.
73:22 I was stupid and had no understanding; I was like a brute beast in your presence.
73:23 Yet I am always with you; you hold me by my right hand.
73:24 You will guide me by your counsel, and afterwards receive me with glory.
73:25 Whom have I in heaven but you? and having you I desire nothing upon earth.
73:26 Though my flesh and my heart should waste away, God is the strength of my heart and my portion for ever.
73:27 Truly, those who forsake you will perish; you destroy all who are unfaithful.
73:28 But it is good for me to be near God; I have made the Lord God my refuge.
73:29 I will speak of all your works in the gates of the city of Zion.

74:1 O God, why have you rejected us for ever? why does your anger smolder against the sheep of your pasture?
74:2 Remember the people you purchased of old, the tribe of your inheritance, whom you redeemedâ€” Mount Zion, where you dwelt.
74:3 Turn your steps toward these everlasting ruins, all this destruction the enemy has brought on the sanctuary.
74:4 Your foes roared in the place where you met with us; they set up their standards as signs.
74:5 They behaved like men wielding axes to cut through a thicket of trees.
74:6 They smashed all the carved paneling with their axes and hatchets.
74:7 They burned your sanctuary to the ground; they defiled the dwelling place of your Name.
74:8 They said in their hearts, 'We will crush them completely!' They burned every place where God was worshiped in the land.
74:9 We are given no signs from God; no prophets are left, and none of us knows how long this will be.
74:10 How long will the enemy mock you, O God? Will the foe revile your name forever?
74:11 Why do you hold back your hand, your right hand? Take it from the folds of your garment and destroy them!
74:12 But God is my King from long ago; he brings salvation on the earth.
74:13 It was you who split open the sea by your power; you broke the heads of the monster in the waters.
74:14 It was you who crushed the heads of Leviathan and gave it as food to the creatures of the desert.
74:15 It was you who opened up springs and streams; you dried up the ever-flowing rivers.
74:16 The day is yours, and yours also the night; you established the sun and moon.
74:17 It was you who set all the boundaries of the earth; you made both summer and winter.
74:18 Remember how the enemy has mocked you, Lord, how foolish people have reviled your name.
74:19 Do not hand over the life of your dove to wild beasts; do not forget the lives of your afflicted people forever.
74:20 Have regard for your covenant, because haunts of violence fill the dark places of the land.
74:21 Do not let the oppressed retreat in disgrace; may the poor and needy praise your name.
74:22 Rise up, O God, and defend your cause; remember how fools mock you all day long.
74:23 Do not ignore the clamor of your adversaries, the uproar of your enemies, which rises continually.

75:1 We give you thanks, O God, we give you thanks, for your Name is near, as your wonderful works declare.
75:2 'I will appoint a time,' says God; 'I will judge with equity.
75:3 Though the earth and all its inhabitants are quaking, I will make its pillars fast.
75:4 I say to the arrogant, "Do not boast," and to the wicked, "Do not lift up your horn;
75:5 Do not lift up your horn on high, nor speak with a stiff neck."' 
75:6 For no one from the east or from the west, or from the wild places of the south, can raise a man up.
75:7 It is God who is the judge; he puts down one and lifts up another.
75:8 For in the hand of the Lord there is a cup, full of foaming wine mixed with spices; he pours it out for all the wicked of the earth to drink its dregs and to drain them.
75:9 But I will rejoice for ever; I will sing praises to the God of Jacob.
75:10 All the horns of the wicked will I break off, but the horns of the righteous shall be exalted.

76:1 In Judah is God known; his Name is great in Israel.
76:2 At Salem is his tabernacle, and his dwelling is in Zion.
76:3 There he broke the flashing arrows, the shield, the sword, and the weapons of war.
76:4 How glorious you are! more majestic than the everlasting mountains.
76:5 The strong of heart have been despoiled; they sink into sleep; none of the warriors can lift a hand.
76:6 At your rebuke, O God of Jacob, both horse and rider lie stunned.
76:7 What terror you inspire! who can stand before you when you are angry?
76:8 From heaven you pronounced judgment; the earth was afraid and was still,
76:9 When God rose up to judgment and to save all the oppressed of the earth.
76:10 Truly, wrathful Edom will give you thanks, and the remnant of Hamath will keep your feast.
76:11 Make vows to the Lord your God and perform them; let all who are round about him bring gifts to him who is worthy to be feared.
76:12 He quells the spirit of princes, and strikes terror in the kings of the earth.

77:1 I will cry aloud to God; I will cry aloud, and he will hear me.
77:2 In the day of my trouble I sought the Lord; my hands were stretched out by night and did not tire; I refused to be comforted.
77:3 I think of God, I am restless, I ponder, and my spirit faints.
77:4 You will not let my eyelids close; I am so troubled that I cannot speak.
77:5 I consider the days of old; I remember the years long ago;
77:6 I commune with my heart in the night; I ponder and search my mind.
77:7 Will the Lord cast me off for ever? will he no more show his favor?
77:8 Has his loving-kindness come to an end for ever? has his promise failed for evermore?
77:9 Has God forgotten to be gracious? has he, in his anger, withheld his compassion?
77:10 And I said, 'My grief is this: that the right hand of the Most High has lost its power.'
77:11 I will remember the works of the Lord and call to mind your wonders of old time.
77:12 I will meditate on all your acts and ponder your mighty deeds.
77:13 Your way, O God, is holy; who is so great a god as our God?
77:14 You are the God who works wonders and have declared your power among the peoples.
77:15 By your strength you have redeemed your people, the children of Jacob and Joseph.
77:16 The waters saw you, O God; the waters saw you and trembled; the very depths were shaken.
77:17 The clouds poured out water; the skies thundered; your arrows flashed to and fro.
77:18 The sound of your thunder was in the whirlwind; your lightnings lit up the world; the earth trembled and shook.
77:19 Your way was in the sea, and your paths in the great waters, yet your footsteps were not seen.
77:20 You led your people like a flock by the hand of Moses and Aaron.

78:1 Hear my teaching, O my people; incline your ears to the words of my mouth.
78:2 I will open my mouth in a parable; I will declare the mysteries of ancient times.
78:3 That which we have heard and known, and what our forefathers have told us, we will not hide from their children.
78:4 We will recount to generations to come the praiseworthy deeds and the power of the Lord, and the wonderful works he has done.
78:5 He gave his decrees to Jacob and established a law for Israel, which he commanded them to teach their children;
78:6 That the generations to come might know, even the children yet to be born, that they in their turn might tell it to their children;
78:7 So that they might put their trust in God, and not forget the deeds of God, but keep his commandments;
78:8 And not be like their forefathers, a stubborn and rebellious generation, a generation whose heart was not steadfast, and whose spirit was not faithful to God.
78:9 The people of Ephraim, armed with the bow, turned back in the day of battle;
78:10 They did not keep the covenant of God, and refused to walk in his law;
78:11 They forgot what he had done, and the wonders he had shown them.
78:12 He worked marvels in the sight of their forefathers, in the land of Egypt, in the field of Zoan.
78:13 He split open the sea and let them pass through; he made the waters stand up like walls.
78:14 He led them with a cloud by day, and all the night through with a glow of fire.
78:15 He split the hard rocks in the wilderness and gave them drink as from the great deep.
78:16 He brought streams out of the cliff, and the waters gushed out like rivers.
78:17 But they went on sinning against him, rebelling in the desert against the Most High.
78:18 They tested God in their hearts, demanding food for their craving.
78:19 They railed against God and said, 'Can God set a table in the wilderness?
78:20 True, he struck the rock, the waters gushed out, and the gullies overflowed; but is he able to give bread or to provide meat for his people?'
78:21 When the Lord heard this, he was full of wrath; a fire was kindled against Jacob, and his anger mounted against Israel;
78:22 For they had no faith in God, nor did they put their trust in his saving power.
78:23 So he commanded the clouds above and opened the doors of heaven.
78:24 He rained down manna upon them to eat and gave them grain from heaven.
78:25 So mortals ate the bread of angels; he provided for them food enough.
78:26 He caused the east wind to blow in the heavens and led out the south wind by his might.
78:27 He rained down flesh upon them like dust and winged birds like the sand of the sea.
78:28 He let it fall in the midst of their camp and round about their dwellings.
78:29 So they ate and were well filled, for he gave them what they craved.
78:30 But they did not stop their craving, though the food was still in their mouths.
78:31 So God's anger mounted against them; he slew their strongest men and laid low the youth of Israel.
78:32 In spite of all this, they went on sinning and had no faith in his wonderful works.
78:33 So he brought their days to an end like a breath and their years in sudden terror.
78:34 Whenever he slew them, they would seek him, and repent, and diligently search for God.
78:35 They would remember that God was their rock, and the Most High God their redeemer.
78:36 But they flattered him with their mouths and lied to him with their tongues.
78:37 Their heart was not steadfast toward him, and they were not faithful to his covenant.
78:38 But he, being merciful, forgave their sins and did not destroy them; many times he held back his anger and did not permit his wrath to be roused.
78:39 For he remembered that they were but flesh, a breath that goes forth and does not return.
78:40 How often the people disobeyed him in the wilderness and offended him in the desert!
78:41 Again and again they tempted God and provoked the Holy One of Israel.
78:42 They did not remember his power in the day when he ransomed them from the enemy;
78:43 How he wrought his signs in Egypt and his omens in the field of Zoan.
78:44 He turned their rivers into blood, so that they could not drink of their streams.
78:45 He sent swarms of flies among them, which ate them up, and frogs, which destroyed them.
78:46 He gave their crops to the caterpillar, the fruit of their toil to the locust.
78:47 He killed their vines with hail and their sycamores with frost.
78:48 He gave over their cattle to hailstones and their flocks to hot thunderbolts.
78:49 He poured out upon them his blazing anger: fury, indignation, and distress, a troop of destroying angels.
78:50 He gave his anger full rein; he did not spare them from death; but gave their lives over to the plague.
78:51 He struck down all the firstborn of Egypt, the flower of manhood in the dwellings of Ham.
78:52 He led out his people like sheep and guided them in the wilderness like a flock.
78:53 He led them to safety, and they were not afraid; but the sea overwhelmed their enemies.
78:54 He brought them to his holy land, the mountain his right hand had won.
78:55 He drove out the nations before them and allotted them their inheritance; he settled the tribes of Israel in their tents.
78:56 But they tested the Most High God and defied him, nor did they keep his testimonies;
78:57 They turned away and were as faithless as their fathers; they were as unreliable as a slack bow.
78:58 They grieved him with their hill-altars and provoked his displeasure with their idols.
78:59 When God heard this, he was angry and utterly rejected Israel.
78:60 He forsook the shrine at Shiloh, the tent where he had lived among his people.
78:61 He delivered the ark into captivity, his glory into the adversary's hand.
78:62 He gave his people to the sword and was angered against his inheritance.
78:63 The fire consumed their young men; there were no wedding songs for their maidens.
78:64 Their priests fell by the sword, and their widows made no lamentation.
78:65 Then the Lord woke as though from sleep, like a warrior refreshed with wine.
78:66 He struck his enemies on the backside and put them to perpetual shame.
78:67 He rejected the tent of Joseph and did not choose the tribe of Ephraim;
78:68 He chose instead the tribe of Judah and Mount Zion, which he loved.
78:69 He built his sanctuary like the heights of heaven, like the earth which he founded for ever.
78:70 He chose David his servant, and took him away from the sheepfolds.
78:71 He brought him from following the ewes, to be a shepherd over Jacob his people and over Israel his inheritance.
78:72 So he shepherded them with a faithful and true heart and guided them with the skillfulness of his hands.

79:1 O God, the heathen have come into your inheritance; they have profaned your holy temple; they have made Jerusalem a heap of rubble.
79:2 They have given the bodies of your servants as food for the birds of the air, and the flesh of your faithful ones to the beasts of the field.
79:3 They have shed their blood like water on every side of Jerusalem, and there was no one to bury them.
79:4 We have become a reproach to our neighbors, an object of scorn and derision to those around us.
79:5 How long will you be angry, O Lord? will your fury blaze like fire for ever?
79:6 Pour out your wrath upon the heathen who have not known you, and upon the kingdoms that have not called upon your Name.
79:7 For they have devoured Jacob and made his dwelling a ruin.
79:8 Remember not our past sins; let your compassion be swift to meet us; for we have been brought very low.
79:9 Help us, O God our Savior, for the glory of your Name; deliver us and forgive us our sins, for your Name's sake.
79:10 Why should the heathen say, 'Where is their God?'
79:11 Let it be known among the heathen in our sight that you avenge the shedding of your servants' blood.
79:12 Let the sorrowful sighing of the prisoners come before you, and by your great might spare those who are condemned to die.
79:13 Render to our neighbors sevenfold into their bosoms the reproach with which they have reproached you, O Lord.
79:14 So we who are your people and the sheep of your pasture will give you thanks for ever, and show forth your praise from age to age.

80:1 Hear, O Shepherd of Israel, leading Joseph like a flock; shine forth, you that are enthroned upon the cherubim.
80:2 In the presence of Ephraim, Benjamin, and Manasseh, stir up your strength and come to help us.
80:3 Restore us, O God of hosts; show the light of your countenance, and we shall be saved.
80:4 O Lord God of hosts, how long will you be angered despite the prayers of your people?
80:5 You have fed them with the bread of tears; you have given them bowls of tears to drink.
80:6 You have made us the derision of our neighbors, and our enemies laugh us to scorn.
80:7 Restore us, O God of hosts; show the light of your countenance, and we shall be saved.
80:8 You have brought a vine out of Egypt; you cast out the nations and planted it.
80:9 You prepared the ground for it; it took root and filled the land.
80:10 The mountains were covered by its shadow and the towering cedars by its branches.
80:11 It stretched out its roots to the Sea and its branches to the River.
80:12 Why have you broken down its wall, so that all who pass by pluck off its grapes?
80:13 The wild boar out of the wood roots it up, and the wild beasts of the field devour it.
80:14 Turn now, O God of hosts, look down from heaven; behold and tend this vine; preserve what your right hand has planted.
80:15 At your rebuke they perish; they are cut down and feast upon by fire.
80:16 Let your hand be upon the man of your right hand, the son of man you have made so strong for yourself.
80:17 And so will we never turn away from you; give us life, that we may call upon your Name.
80:18 Restore us, O Lord God of hosts; show the light of your countenance, and we shall be saved.

81:1 Sing with joy to God our strength and raise a loud shout to the God of Jacob.
81:2 Raise a song and sound the timbrel, the merry harp, and the lyre.
81:3 Blow the ram's-horn at the new moon, and at the full moon, the day of our feast.
81:4 For this is a statute for Israel, a law of the God of Jacob.
81:5 He laid it as a solemn charge upon Joseph, when he came out of the land of Egypt.
81:6 I heard an unfamiliar voice saying, 'I eased his shoulder from the burden; his hands were set free from the bearing-basket.
81:7 You called on me in trouble, and I saved you; I answered you from the secret place of thunder and tested you at the waters of Meribah.
81:8 Hear, O my people, and I will admonish you: O Israel, if you would but listen to me!
81:9 There shall be no strange god among you; you shall not worship a foreign god.
81:10 I am the Lord your God, who brought you out of the land of Egypt and said, "Open your mouth wide, and I will fill it."
81:11 But my people did not hear my voice, and Israel would not obey me.
81:12 So I gave them over to the stubbornness of their hearts, to follow their own devices.
81:13 Oh, that my people would listen to me! that Israel would walk in my ways!
81:14 I should soon subdue their enemies and turn my hand against their foes.
81:15 Those who hate the Lord would cringe before him, and their punishment would last for ever.
81:16 But Israel would I feed with the finest wheat and satisfy him with honey from the rock.'

82:1 God has taken his place in the divine council; in the midst of the gods he holds judgment:
82:2 'How long will you judge unjustly and show partiality to the wicked? Selah
82:3 Give justice to the weak and the orphan; maintain the right of the lowly and the destitute.
82:4 Rescue the weak and the needy; deliver them from the hand of the wicked.'
82:5 They have neither knowledge nor understanding, they walk around in darkness; all the foundations of the earth are shaken.
82:6 I say, 'You are gods, children of the Most High, all of you;
82:7 nevertheless, you shall die like mortals, and fall like any prince.'
82:8 Rise up, O God, judge the earth; for all the nations belong to you!

83:1 O God, do not keep silence; do not hold your peace or be still, O God!
83:2 Even now your enemies are in tumult; those who hate you have raised their heads.
83:3 They lay crafty plans against your people; they consult together against those you protect.
83:4 They say, 'Come, let us wipe them out as a nation; let the name of Israel be remembered no more.'
83:5 They conspire with one accord; against you they make a covenantâ€”
83:6 the tents of Edom and the Ishmaelites, Moab and the Hagrites,
83:7 Gebal and Ammon and Amalek, Philistia with the inhabitants of Tyre;
83:8 Assyria also has joined them; they are the strong arm of the children of Lot. Selah
83:9 Do to them as you did to Midian, as to Sisera and Jabin at the river Kishon,
83:10 who were destroyed at En-dor, who became dung for the ground.
83:11 Make their nobles like Oreb and Zeeb, all their princes like Zebah and Zalmunna,
83:12 who said, 'Let us take the pastures of God for our own possession.'
83:13 O my God, make them like whirling dust, like chaff before the wind.
83:14 As fire consumes the forest, as the flame sets the mountains ablaze,
83:15 so pursue them with your tempest and terrify them with your hurricane.
83:16 Fill their faces with shame, so that they may seek your name, O Lord.
83:17 Let them be put to shame and dismayed forever; let them perish in disgrace.
83:18 Let them know that you alone, whose name is the Lord, are the Most High over all the earth.

84:1 How lovely is your dwelling place, O Lord of hosts!
84:2 My soul longs, indeed it faints for the courts of the Lord; my heart and my flesh sing for joy to the living God.
84:3 Even the sparrow finds a home, and the swallow a nest for herself, where she may lay her young, at your altars, O Lord of hosts, my King and my God.
84:4 Happy are those who live in your house, ever singing your praise. Selah
84:5 Happy are those whose strength is in you, in whose heart are the highways to Zion.
84:6 As they go through the valley of Baca they make it a place of springs; the early rain also covers it with pools.
84:7 They go from strength to strength; the God of gods will be seen in Zion.
84:8 O Lord God of hosts, hear my prayer; give ear, O God of Jacob! Selah
84:9 Behold our shield, O God; look on the face of your anointed.
84:10 For a day in your courts is better than a thousand elsewhere. I would rather be a doorkeeper in the house of my God than live in the tents of wickedness.
84:11 For the Lord God is a sun and shield; he bestows favor and honor. No good thing does the Lord withhold from those who walk uprightly.
84:12 O Lord of hosts, happy is everyone who trusts in you.

85:1 Lord, you were favorable to your land; you restored the fortunes of Jacob.
85:2 You forgave the iniquity of your people; you pardoned all their sin. Selah
85:3 You withdrew all your wrath; you turned from your hot anger.
85:4 Restore us again, O God of our salvation, and put away your indignation toward us.
85:5 Will you be angry with us forever? Will you prolong your anger to all generations?
85:6 Will you not revive us again, so that your people may rejoice in you?
85:7 Show us your steadfast love, O Lord, and grant us your salvation.
85:8 Let me hear what God the Lord will speak, for he will speak peace to his people, to his faithful, to those who turn to him in their hearts.
85:9 Surely his salvation is at hand for those who fear him, that his glory may dwell in our land.
85:10 Steadfast love and faithfulness will meet; righteousness and peace will kiss each other.
85:11 Faithfulness will spring up from the ground, and righteousness will look down from the sky.
85:12 The Lord will give what is good, and our land will yield its increase.
85:13 Righteousness will go before him, and will make a path for his steps.

86:1 Bow down your ear, O Lord, and answer me, for I am poor and in misery.
86:2 Keep watch over my life, for I am faithful; save your servant who puts his trust in you.
86:3 Be merciful to me, O Lord, for you are my God; I call upon you all the day long.
86:4 Gladden the soul of your servant, for to you, O Lord, I lift up my soul.
86:5 For you, Lord, are good and forgiving, and great is your love toward all who call upon you.
86:6 Give ear, O Lord, to my prayer, and attend to the voice of my supplications.
86:7 In the time of my trouble I will call upon you, for you will answer me.
86:8 Among the gods there is none like you, O Lord, nor anything like your works.
86:9 All the nations you have made will come and worship you, O Lord, and glorify your Name.
86:10 For you are great; you do wondrous things; and you alone are God.
86:11 Teach me your way, O Lord, and I will walk in your truth; knit my heart to you, that I may fear your Name.
86:12 I will thank you, O Lord my God, with all my heart, and glorify your Name for evermore.
86:13 For great is your love toward me; you have delivered me from the nethermost Pit.
86:14 The arrogant rise up against me, O God, and a band of violent men seeks my life; they have not set you before their eyes.
86:15 But you, O Lord, are gracious and full of compassion, slow to anger, and full of kindness and truth.
86:16 Turn to me and have mercy upon me; give your strength to your servant, and save the child of your handmaid.
86:17 Show me a sign of your favor, so that those who hate me may see it and be ashamed; because you, O Lord, have helped me and comforted me.

87:1 On the holy mountain stands the city he has founded; the Lord loves the gates of Zion more than all the dwellings of Jacob.
87:2 Glorious things are spoken of you, O city of our God.
87:3 I count Egypt and Babylon among those who know me; behold Philistia, Tyre, and Ethiopia: in Zion were they born.
87:4 Of Zion it shall be said, 'Everyone was born in her, and the Most High himself shall establish her.'
87:5 The Lord will record as he enlists the peoples, 'These were born there.'
87:6 The singers and the dancers will say, 'All my fresh springs are in you.'

88:1 O Lord, my God, my Savior, by day and night I cry to you.
88:2 Let my prayer enter into your presence; incline your ear to me and save me.
88:3 For I am full of trouble; my life draws near to the grave.
88:4 I am counted among those who go down into the Pit; I am like one who has no strength.
88:5 Lost among the dead, like the slain who lie in the grave,
88:6 Whom you remember no more, for they are cut off from your hand.
88:7 You have laid me in the lowest Pit, in a dark place, and in the abyss.
88:8 Your anger weighs upon me heavily, and all your great waves overwhelm me.
88:9 You have put my friends far from me; you have made me to be abhorred by them; I am in prison and cannot get out.
88:10 My sight has failed me because of trouble; Lord, I have called upon you daily; I have stretched out my hands to you.
88:11 Do you work wonders for the dead? will those who have died stand up and praise you?
88:12 Will your loving-kindness be declared in the grave? your faithfulness in the land of destruction?
88:13 Will your wonders be known in the dark? or your righteousness in the country where all is forgotten?
88:14 But as for me, O Lord, I cry to you for help; in the morning my prayer comes before you.
88:15 Lord, why have you rejected me? why have you hidden your face from me?
88:16 Ever since my youth, I have been wretched and at the point of death; I have borne your terrors with a troubled mind.
88:17 Your blazing anger has swept over me; your terrors have destroyed me;
88:18 They surround me all day long like a flood; they encompass me on every side.
88:19 My friend and my neighbor you have put away from me, and darkness is my only companion.

89:1 I will sing of your steadfast love, O Lord, forever; with my mouth I will proclaim your faithfulness to all generations.
89:2 I declare that your steadfast love is established forever; your faithfulness is as firm as the heavens.
89:3 You said, 'I have made a covenant with my chosen one, I have sworn to my servant David:
89:4 "I will establish your descendants forever, and build your throne for all generations."' Selah
89:5 Let the heavens praise your wonders, O Lord, your faithfulness in the assembly of the holy ones.
89:6 For who in the skies can be compared to the Lord? Who among the heavenly beings is like the Lord,
89:7 a God feared in the council of the holy ones, great and awesome above all that are around him?
89:8 O Lord God of hosts, who is as mighty as you, O Lord? Your faithfulness surrounds you.
89:9 You rule the raging of the sea; when its waves rise, you still them.
89:10 You crushed Rahab like a carcass; you scattered your enemies with your mighty arm.
89:11 The heavens are yours, the earth also is yours; the world and all that is in itâ€”you have founded them.
89:12 The north and the southâ€”you created them; Tabor and Hermon joyously praise your name.
89:13 You have a mighty arm; strong is your hand, high your right hand.
89:14 Righteousness and justice are the foundation of your throne; steadfast love and faithfulness go before you.
89:15 Happy are the people who know the festal shout, who walk, O Lord, in the light of your countenance;
89:16 they exult in your name all day long, and extol your righteousness.
89:17 For you are the glory of their strength; by your favor our horn is exalted.
89:18 For our shield belongs to the Lord, our king to the Holy One of Israel.
89:19 Then you spoke in a vision to your faithful one, and said: 'I have set the crown on one who is mighty, I have exalted one chosen from the people.
89:20 I have found my servant David; with my holy oil I have anointed him;
89:21 my hand shall always remain with him; my arm also shall strengthen him.
89:22 The enemy shall not outwit him, the wicked shall not humble him.
89:23 I will crush his foes before him and strike down those who hate him.
89:24 My faithfulness and steadfast love shall be with him; and in my name his horn shall be exalted.
89:25 I will set his hand on the sea and his right hand on the rivers.
89:26 He shall cry to me, "You are my Father, my God, and the Rock of my salvation."
89:27 I will make him the firstborn, the highest of the kings of the earth.
89:28 Forever I will keep my steadfast love for him, and my covenant with him will stand firm.
89:29 I will establish his line forever, and his throne as long as the heavens endure.
89:30 If his children forsake my law and do not walk according to my ordinances,
89:31 if they violate my statutes and do not keep my commandments,
89:32 then I will punish their transgression with the rod and their iniquity with scourges;
89:33 but I will not remove from him my steadfast love, or be false to my faithfulness.
89:34 I will not violate my covenant, or alter the word that went forth from my lips.
89:35 Once and for all I have sworn by my holiness; I will not lie to David.
89:36 His line shall continue forever, and his throne endure before me like the sun.
89:37 It shall be established forever like the moon, an enduring witness in the skies.' Selah
89:38 But now you have spurned and rejected him; you are full of wrath against your anointed.
89:39 You have renounced the covenant with your servant; you have defiled his crown in the dust.
89:40 You have broken through all his walls; you have laid his strongholds in ruins.
89:41 All who pass by plunder him; he has become the scorn of his neighbors.
89:42 You have exalted the right hand of his foes; you have made all his enemies rejoice.
89:43 Moreover, you have turned back the edge of his sword, and you have not supported him in battle.
89:44 You have removed the scepter from his hand, and hurled his throne to the ground.
89:45 You have cut short the days of his youth; you have covered him with shame. Selah
89:46 How long, O Lord? Will you hide yourself forever? How long will your wrath burn like fire?
89:47 Remember how short my time isâ€” for what vanity you have created all mortals!
89:48 Who can live and never see death? Who can escape the power of Sheol? Selah
89:49 Lord, where is your steadfast love of old, which by your faithfulness you swore to David?
89:50 Remember, O Lord, how your servant is taunted; how I bear in my bosom the insults of the peoples,
89:51 with which your enemies taunt, O Lord, with which they taunted the footsteps of your anointed.
89:52 Blessed be the Lord forever. Amen and Amen.

90:1 Lord, you have been our refuge from one generation to another.
90:2 Before the mountains were brought forth, or the earth and the world were made, from age to age you are God.
90:3 You turn us back to the dust and say, 'Go back, O child of earth.'
90:4 For a thousand years in your sight are like yesterday when it is past and like a watch in the night.
90:5 You sweep us away like a dream; we fade away suddenly like the grass.
90:6 In the morning it is green and flourishes; in the evening it is dried up and withered.
90:7 For we consume away in your displeasure; we are afraid at your wrathful indignation.
90:8 Our iniquities you have set before you, and our secret sins in the light of your countenance.
90:9 When you are angry, all our days are gone; we bring our years to an end like a sigh.
90:10 The span of our life is seventy years, perhaps in strength even eighty; yet the sum of them is but labor and sorrow, for they pass away quickly and we are gone.
90:11 Who regards the power of your wrath? who rightly fears your indignation?
90:12 So teach us to number our days that we may apply our hearts to wisdom.
90:13 Return, O Lord; how long will you tarry? be gracious to your servants.
90:14 Satisfy us with your loving-kindness in the morning; so shall we rejoice and be glad all the days of our life.
90:15 Make us glad by the measure of the days that you afflicted us and the years in which we suffered adversity.
90:16 Show your servants your works and your splendor to their children.
90:17 May the graciousness of the Lord our God be upon us; prosper the work of our hands; prosper our handiwork.

91:1 He who dwells in the shelter of the Most High, abides under the shadow of the Almighty.
91:2 He shall say to the Lord, 'You are my refuge and my stronghold, my God in whom I put my trust.'
91:3 He shall deliver you from the snare of the hunter and from the deadly pestilence.
91:4 He shall cover you with his pinions, and you shall find refuge under his wings; his faithfulness shall be a shield and buckler.
91:5 You shall not be afraid of any terror by night, nor of the arrow that flies by day;
91:6 Of the plague that stalks in the darkness, nor of the sickness that lays waste at mid-day.
91:7 A thousand shall fall at your side and ten thousand at your right hand, but it shall not come near you.
91:8 Your eyes have only to behold to see the reward of the wicked.
91:9 Because you have made the Lord your refuge, and the Most High your habitation,
91:10 There shall no evil happen to you, neither shall any plague come near your dwelling.
91:11 For he shall give his angels charge over you, to keep you in all your ways.
91:12 They shall bear you in their hands, lest you dash your foot against a stone.
91:13 You shall tread upon the lion and adder; you shall trample the young lion and the serpent under your feet.
91:14 Because he is bound to me in love, therefore will I deliver him; I will protect him, because he knows my Name.
91:15 He shall call upon me, and I will answer him; I am with him in trouble; I will rescue him and bring him to honor.
91:16 With long life will I satisfy him and show him my salvation.

92:1 It is a good thing to give thanks to the Lord and to sing praises to your Name, O Most High;
92:2 To tell of your loving-kindness early in the morning and of your faithfulness in the night season;
92:3 On the ten-stringed instrument and on the lute, and with the solemn sound of the harp.
92:4 For you, Lord, have made me glad by your acts, and I sing for joy at the works of your hands.
92:5 Lord, how glorious are your works! your thoughts are very deep.
92:6 The dullard does not know, nor does the fool understand, that though the wicked grow like grass and all the workers of iniquity flourish,
92:7 It is only to be destroyed for ever; but you, Lord, are exalted for evermore.
92:8 For lo, your enemies, O Lord, lo, your enemies shall perish, and all the workers of iniquity shall be scattered.
92:9 But my horn you have exalted like the horns of wild bulls; I am anointed with fresh oil.
92:10 My eyes also look down upon my enemies, and my ears hear with joy the end of the wicked who rise up against me.
92:11 The righteous shall flourish like a palm tree and shall spread abroad like a cedar of Lebanon.
92:12 Those who are planted in the house of the Lord shall flourish in the courts of our God;
92:13 They shall still bring forth fruit in old age; they shall be green and succulent;
92:14 That they may show how upright the Lord is, my Rock, in whom there is no fault.

93:1 The Lord is king, he is robed in majesty; the Lord is robed, he is girded with strength. He has established the world; it shall never be moved;
93:2 your throne is established from of old; you are from everlasting.
93:3 The floods have lifted up, O Lord, the floods have lifted up their voice; the floods lift up their roaring.
93:4 More majestic than the thunders of mighty waters, more majestic than the waves of the sea, majestic on high is the Lord!
93:5 Your decrees are very sure; holiness befits your house, O Lord, forevermore.

94:1 O Lord God of vengeance, O God of vengeance, show yourself.
94:2 Rise up, O judge of the world; give the arrogant their just deserts.
94:3 How long shall the wicked, O Lord, how long shall the wicked triumph?
94:4 They bluster in their insolence; all evildoers are full of boasting.
94:5 They crush your people, O Lord, and afflict your chosen nation.
94:6 They murder the widow and the stranger and put the orphans to death.
94:7 Yet they say, 'The Lord does not see, the God of Jacob takes no notice.'
94:8 Consider well, you dullards among the people; when will you fools understand?
94:9 He that planted the ear, does he not hear? he that formed the eye, does he not see?
94:10 He who admonishes the nations, will he not punish? he who teaches all the world, has he no knowledge?
94:11 The Lord knows our human thoughts; how like a puff of wind they are.
94:12 Happy are they whom you instruct, O Lord! whom you teach out of your law;
94:13 To give them rest in evil days, until a pit is dug for the wicked.
94:14 For the Lord will not abandon his people, nor will he forsake his own.
94:15 For judgment will again be just, and all the true of heart will follow it.
94:16 Who rose up for me against the wicked? who took my part against the evildoers?
94:17 If the Lord had not come to my help, I should soon have dwelt in the land of silence.
94:18 As often as I said, 'My foot has slipped,' your love, O Lord, upheld me.
94:19 When many cares fill my mind, your consolations cheer my soul.
94:20 Can a corrupt throne be allied with you, one that forms mischief by statute?
94:21 They conspire against the life of the just and condemn the innocent to death.
94:22 But the Lord has become my stronghold, and my God the rock of my trust.
94:23 He will turn their wickedness back upon them and destroy them in their own malice; the Lord our God will destroy them.

95:1 Come, let us sing to the Lord; let us shout for joy to the Rock of our salvation.
95:2 Let us come before his presence with thanksgiving and raise a loud shout to him with psalms.
95:3 For the Lord is a great God, and a great King above all gods.
95:4 In his hand are the caverns of the earth, and the heights of the hills are his also.
95:5 The sea is his, for he made it, and his hands have molded the dry land.
95:6 Come, let us bow down, and bend the knee, and kneel before the Lord our Maker.
95:7 For he is our God, and we are the people of his pasture and the sheep of his hand. Oh, that today you would hearken to his voice!
95:8 Harden not your hearts, as your forebears did in the wilderness, at Meribah, and on that day at Massah, when they tempted me.
95:9 They put me to the test, though they had seen my works.
95:10 Forty years long I detested that generation and said, 'This people are wayward in their hearts; they do not know my ways.'
95:11 So I swore in my wrath, 'They shall not enter into my rest.'

96:1 Sing to the Lord a new song; sing to the Lord, all the whole earth.
96:2 Sing to the Lord and bless his Name; proclaim the good news of his salvation from day to day.
96:3 Declare his glory among the nations and his wonders among all peoples.
96:4 For great is the Lord and greatly to be praised; he is more to be feared than all gods.
96:5 As for all the gods of the nations, they are but idols; but it is the Lord who made the heavens.
96:6 Oh, the majesty and magnificence of his presence! Oh, the power and the splendor of his sanctuary!
96:7 Ascribe to the Lord, you families of the peoples; ascribe to the Lord honor and power.
96:8 Ascribe to the Lord the honor due his Name; bring offerings and come into his courts.
96:9 Worship the Lord in the beauty of holiness; let the whole earth tremble before him.
96:10 Tell it out among the nations: 'The Lord is King! he has made the world so firm that it cannot be moved; he will judge the peoples with equity.'
96:11 Let the heavens rejoice, and let the earth be glad; let the sea thunder and all that is in it; let the field be joyful and all that is therein.
96:12 Then shall all the trees of the wood shout for joy before the Lord when he comes, when he comes to judge the earth.
96:13 He will judge the world with righteousness and the peoples with his truth.

97:1 The Lord is King; let the earth rejoice; let the multitude of the isles be glad.
97:2 Clouds and darkness are round about him, righteousness and justice are the foundations of his throne.
97:3 A fire goes before him and burns up his enemies on every side.
97:4 His lightnings light up the world; the earth sees it and is afraid.
97:5 The mountains melt like wax at the presence of the Lord, at the presence of the Lord of the whole earth.
97:6 The heavens declare his righteousness, and all the peoples see his glory.
97:7 Confounded be all who worship carved images and delight in false gods! Bow down before him, all you gods.
97:8 Zion hears and is glad, and the cities of Judah rejoice, because of your judgments, O Lord.
97:9 For you are the Lord, most high over all the earth; you are exalted far above all gods.
97:10 The Lord loves those who hate evil; he preserves the lives of his saints and delivers them from the hand of the wicked.
97:11 Light has sprung up for the righteous, and joyful gladness for those who are true of heart.
97:12 Rejoice in the Lord, you righteous, and give thanks to his holy Name.

98:1 O sing to the Lord a new song, for he has done marvelous things. His right hand and his holy arm have gotten him victory.
98:2 The Lord has made known his victory; he has revealed his vindication in the sight of the nations.
98:3 He has remembered his steadfast love and faithfulness to the house of Israel. All the ends of the earth have seen the victory of our God.
98:4 Make a joyful noise to the Lord, all the earth; break forth into joyous song and sing praises.
98:5 Sing praises to the Lord with the lyre, with the lyre and the sound of melody.
98:6 With trumpets and the sound of the horn make a joyful noise before the King, the Lord.
98:7 Let the sea roar, and all that fills it; the world and those who live in it.
98:8 Let the floods clap their hands; let the hills sing together for joy
98:9 at the presence of the Lord, for he is coming to judge the earth. He will judge the world with righteousness, and the peoples with equity.

99:1 The Lord is king; let the peoples tremble! He sits enthroned upon the cherubim; let the earth quake!
99:2 The Lord is great in Zion; he is exalted over all the peoples.
99:3 Let them praise your great and awesome name. Holy is he!
99:4 Mighty King, lover of justice, you have established equity; you have executed justice and righteousness in Jacob.
99:5 Extol the Lord our God; worship at his footstool. Holy is he!
99:6 Moses and Aaron were among his priests, Samuel also was among those who called on his name. They cried to the Lord, and he answered them.
99:7 He spoke to them in the pillar of cloud; they kept his decrees, and the statutes that he gave them.
99:8 O Lord our God, you answered them; you were a forgiving God to them, but an avenger of their wrongdoings.
99:9 Extol the Lord our God, and worship at his holy mountain; for the Lord our God is holy.

100:1 Make a joyful noise to the Lord, all the earth.
100:2 Worship the Lord with gladness; come into his presence with singing.
100:3 Know that the Lord is God. It is he that made us, and we are his; we are his people, and the sheep of his pasture.
100:4 Enter his gates with thanksgiving, and his courts with praise. Give thanks to him, bless his name.
100:5 For the Lord is good; his steadfast love endures forever, and his faithfulness to all generations.

101:1 I will sing of loyalty and of justice; to you, O Lord, I will sing.
101:2 I will give heed to the way that is blameless. Oh when will you come to me? I will walk with integrity of heart within my house;
101:3 I will not set before my eyes anything that is base. I hate the work of those who fall away; it shall not cling to me.
101:4 Perverseness of heart shall be far from me; I will know nothing of evil.
101:5 One who secretly slanders a neighbor I will destroy. A haughty look and an arrogant heart I will not tolerate.
101:6 I will look with favor on the faithful in the land, so that they may live with me; whoever walks in the way that is blameless shall minister to me.
101:7 No one who practices deceit shall remain in my house; no one who utters lies shall continue in my presence.
101:8 Morning by morning I will destroy all the wicked in the land, cutting off all evildoers from the city of the Lord.

102:1 Lord, hear my prayer, and let my cry come before you.
102:2 Hide not your face from me in the day of my trouble; incline your ear to me; when I call, make haste to answer me.
102:3 For my days drift away like smoke, and my bones are hot as burning coals.
102:4 My heart is smitten like grass and withered, so that I forget to eat my bread.
102:5 Because of the voice of my groaning I am but skin and bones.
102:6 I am like an owl in the desert, like a little owl among the ruins.
102:7 I lie awake and groan; I am like a sparrow, alone upon a housetop.
102:8 My enemies revile me all day long, and those who scoff at me have taken an oath against me.
102:9 For I have eaten ashes for bread and mingled my drink with weeping.
102:10 Because of your indignation and wrath you have lifted me up and thrown me away.
102:11 My days are like a passing shadow, and I wither like the grass.
102:12 But you, O Lord, are enthroned for ever, and your Name endures from age to age.
102:13 You will arise and have compassion on Zion, for it is time to have mercy upon her; indeed, the appointed time has come.
102:14 For your servants love her very stones and are moved to pity even for her dust.
102:15 The nations shall fear your Name, O Lord, and all the kings of the earth your glory.
102:16 For the Lord will build up Zion, and his glory shall appear.
102:17 He will look with favor on the prayer of the homeless; he will not despise their plea.
102:18 Let this be written for a future generation, so that a people yet unborn may praise the Lord.
102:19 For the Lord looked down from his holy place on high; from the heavens he beheld the earth;
102:20 That he might hear the groan of the captive and set free those condemned to die;
102:21 That they may declare in Zion the Name of the Lord, and his praise in Jerusalem;
102:22 When the peoples are gathered together, and the kingdoms also, to serve the Lord.
102:23 He has brought down my strength before my time; he has shortened the number of my days;
102:24 And I said, 'O my God, do not take me away in the midst of my days; your years endure throughout all generations.'
102:25 In the beginning, Lord, you laid the foundations of the earth, and the heavens are the work of your hands;
102:26 They shall perish, but you will endure; they all shall wear out like a garment; as clothing you will change them, and they shall be changed;
102:27 But you are always the same, and your years will never end.
102:28 The children of your servants shall continue, and their offspring shall stand fast in your sight.

103:1 Bless the Lord, O my soul, and all that is within me, bless his holy Name.
103:2 Bless the Lord, O my soul, and forget not all his benefits.
103:3 He forgives all your sins and heals all your infirmities.
103:4 He redeems your life from the grave and crowns you with mercy and loving-kindness.
103:5 He satisfies you with good things, and your youth is renewed like an eagle's.
103:6 The Lord executes righteousness and judgment for all who are oppressed.
103:7 He made his ways known to Moses and his works to the children of Israel.
103:8 The Lord is full of compassion and mercy, slow to anger and of great kindness.
103:9 He will not always accuse us, nor will he keep his anger for ever.
103:10 He has not dealt with us according to our sins, nor rewarded us according to our wickedness.
103:11 For as the heavens are high above the earth, so is his mercy great upon those who fear him.
103:12 As far as the east is from the west, so far has he removed our sins from us.
103:13 As a father cares for his children, so does the Lord care for those who fear him.
103:14 For he himself knows whereof we are made; he remembers that we are but dust.
103:15 Our days are like the grass; we flourish like a flower of the field;
103:16 When the wind goes over it, it is gone, and its place shall know it no more.
103:17 But the merciful goodness of the Lord endures for ever on those who fear him, and his righteousness on children's children;
103:18 On those who keep his covenant and remember his commandments and do them.
103:19 The Lord has set his throne in heaven, and his kingship has dominion over all.
103:20 Bless the Lord, you angels of his, you mighty ones who do his bidding and hearken to the voice of his word.
103:21 Bless the Lord, all you his hosts, you ministers of his who do his will.
103:22 Bless the Lord, all you works of his, in all places of his dominion; bless the Lord, O my soul.

104:1 Bless the Lord, O my soul. O Lord my God, you are very great. You are clothed with honor and majesty,
104:2 wrapped in light as with a garment. You stretch out the heavens like a tent,
104:3 you set the beams of your chambers on the waters, you make the clouds your chariot, you ride on the wings of the wind,
104:4 you make the winds your messengers, fire and flame your ministers.
104:5 You set the earth on its foundations, so that it shall never be shaken.
104:6 You cover it with the deep as with a garment; the waters stood above the mountains.
104:7 At your rebuke they flee; at the sound of your thunder they take to flight.
104:8 They rose up to the mountains, ran down to the valleys to the place that you appointed for them.
104:9 You set a boundary that they may not pass, so that they might not again cover the earth.
104:10 You make springs gush forth in the valleys; they flow between the hills,
104:11 giving drink to every wild animal; the wild asses quench their thirst.
104:12 By the streams the birds of the air have their habitation; they sing among the branches.
104:13 From your lofty abode you water the mountains; the earth is satisfied with the fruit of your work.
104:14 You cause the grass to grow for the cattle, and plants for people to use, to bring forth food from the earth,
104:15 and wine to gladden the human heart, oil to make the face shine, and bread to strengthen the human heart.
104:16 The trees of the Lord are watered abundantly, the cedars of Lebanon that he planted.
104:17 In them the birds build their nests; the stork has its home in the fir trees.
104:18 The high mountains are for the wild goats; the rocks are a refuge for the coneys.
104:19 You have made the moon to mark the seasons; the sun knows its time for setting.
104:20 You make darkness, and it is night, when all the animals of the forest come creeping out.
104:21 The young lions roar for their prey, seeking their food from God.
104:22 When the sun rises, they withdraw and lie down in their dens.
104:23 People go out to their work and to their labor until the evening.
104:24 O Lord, how manifold are your works! In wisdom you have made them all; the earth is full of your creatures.
104:25 Yonder is the sea, great and wide, creeping things innumerable are there, living things both small and great.
104:26 There go the ships, and Leviathan that you formed to sport in it.
104:27 These all look to you to give them their food in due season;
104:28 when you give to them, they gather it up; when you open your hand, they are filled with good things.
104:29 When you hide your face, they are dismayed; when you take away their breath, they die and return to their dust.
104:30 When you send forth your spirit, they are created; and you renew the face of the ground.
104:31 May the glory of the Lord endure forever; may the Lord rejoice in his worksâ€”
104:32 who looks on the earth and it trembles, who touches the mountains and they smoke.
104:33 I will sing to the Lord as long as I live; I will sing praise to my God while I have being.
104:34 May my meditation be pleasing to him, for I rejoice in the Lord.
104:35 Let sinners be consumed from the earth, and let the wicked be no more. Bless the Lord, O my soul. Praise the Lord!

105:1 Give thanks to the Lord and call upon his Name; make known his deeds among the peoples.
105:2 Sing to him, sing praises to him, and speak of all his marvelous works.
105:3 Glory in his holy Name; let the hearts of those who seek the Lord rejoice.
105:4 Search for the Lord and his strength; continually seek his face.
105:5 Remember the marvels he has done, his wonders and the judgments of his mouth,
105:6 O offspring of Abraham his servant, O children of Jacob his chosen.
105:7 He is the Lord our God; his judgments prevail in all the world.
105:8 He has always been mindful of his covenant, the promise he made for a thousand generations:
105:9 The covenant he made with Abraham and the oath he swore to Isaac,
105:10 Which he established as a statute for Jacob, an everlasting covenant for Israel,
105:11 Saying, 'To you will I give the land of Canaan to be your allotted inheritance.'
105:12 When they were few in number, of little account, and sojourners in the land,
105:13 Wandering from nation to nation and from one kingdom to another,
105:14 He let no one oppress them and rebuked kings for their sake,
105:15 Saying, 'Do not touch my anointed and do my prophets no harm.'
105:16 Then he called for a famine in the land and destroyed the entire supply of bread.
105:17 He sent a man before them, Joseph, who was sold as a slave.
