105:18 They bruised his feet in fetters; his neck they put in an iron collar.
105:19 Until his prediction came to pass, the word of the Lord tested him.
105:20 The king sent and released him; the ruler of the peoples set him free.
105:21 He set him as a master over his household, as a ruler over all his possessions,
105:22 To instruct his princes according to his will and to teach his elders wisdom.
105:23 Israel came into Egypt, and Jacob became a sojourner in the land of Ham.
105:24 The Lord made his people exceedingly fruitful; he made them stronger than their enemies;
105:25 Whose heart he turned, so that they hated his people and dealt unjustly with his servants.
105:26 He sent Moses his servant, and Aaron whom he had chosen.
105:27 They worked his signs among them, and wonders in the land of Ham.
105:28 He sent darkness, and it grew dark; but they would not heed his words.
105:29 He turned their waters into blood and caused their fish to die.
105:30 Their land was overrun by frogs, even in the king's chambers.
105:31 He spoke, and there came swarms of insects and gnats within all their borders.
105:32 He gave them hailstones instead of rain, and flames of fire throughout their land.
105:33 He blasted their vines and their fig trees and shattered every tree in their country.
105:34 He spoke, and the locusts came, and young locusts without number;
105:35 Which ate up all the green plants in their land and devoured the fruit of their ground.
105:36 He struck down the firstborn of their land, the firstfruits of all their strength.
105:37 He led out his people with silver and gold; in all their tribes there was not one that stumbled.
105:38 Egypt was glad of their going, because they were afraid of them.
105:39 He spread out a cloud for a covering and a fire to give light in the night season.
105:40 They asked, and quails appeared, and he satisfied them with bread from heaven.
105:41 He opened the rock, and water flowed, so that it ran in the dry places like a river.
105:42 For he remembered his holy word and Abraham his servant.
105:43 So he led forth his people with gladness, his chosen with shouts of joy.
105:44 He gave them the lands of the nations, and they took the fruit of others' toil,
105:45 That they might keep his statutes and observe his laws. Hallelujah!

106:1 Hallelujah! Give thanks to the Lord, for he is good, for his mercy endures for ever.
106:2 Who can declare the mighty acts of the Lord or show forth all his praise?
106:3 Happy are those who act with justice and always do what is right!
106:4 Remember me, O Lord, with the favor you have for your people, and visit me with your saving help;
106:5 That I may see the prosperity of your elect and be glad with the gladness of your people, that I may glory with your inheritance.
106:6 We have sinned as our forebears did; we have done wrong and dealt wickedly.
106:7 In Egypt they did not consider your marvelous works, nor remember the abundance of your love; they defied the Most High at the Red Sea.
106:8 But he saved them for his Name's sake, to make his power known.
106:9 He rebuked the Red Sea, and it dried up, and he led them through the deep as through a desert.
106:10 He saved them from the hand of those who hated them and redeemed them from the hand of the enemy.
106:11 The waters covered their oppressors; not one of them was left.
106:12 Then they believed his words and sang him songs of praise.
106:13 But they soon forgot his deeds and did not wait for his counsel.
106:14 A craving seized them in the wilderness, and they put God to the test in the desert.
106:15 He gave them what they asked, but sent leanness into their soul.
106:16 They envied Moses in the camp, and Aaron, the holy one of the Lord.
106:17 The earth opened and swallowed Dathan and covered the company of Abiram.
106:18 Fire blazed up against their company, and flames devoured the wicked.
106:19 Israel made a bull-calf at Horeb and worshiped a molten image;
106:20 And so they exchanged their Glory for the image of an ox that feeds on grass.
106:21 They forgot God their Savior, who had done great things in Egypt,
106:22 Wonderful deeds in the land of Ham, and fearful things at the Red Sea.
106:23 So he would have destroyed them, had not Moses his chosen stood before him in the breach, to turn away his wrath from consuming them.
106:24 They refused the pleasant land and would not believe his promise.
106:25 They grumbled in their tents and would not listen to the voice of the Lord.
106:26 So he lifted his hand against them, to overthrow them in the wilderness,
106:27 To cast out their seed among the nations, and to scatter them throughout the lands.
106:28 They joined themselves to Baal-Peor and ate sacrifices offered to the dead.
106:29 They provoked him to anger with their actions, and a plague broke out among them.
106:30 Then Phinehas stood up and interceded, and the plague came to an end.
106:31 This was reckoned to him as righteousness throughout all generations for ever.
106:32 Again they angered him at the waters of Meribah, so that he punished Moses because of them;
106:33 For they so embittered his spirit that he spoke rash words with his lips.
106:34 They did not destroy the peoples as the Lord had commanded them.
106:35 They intermingled with the heathen and learned their pagan ways,
106:36 So that they worshiped their idols, which became a snare to them.
106:37 They sacrificed their sons and their daughters to evil spirits.
106:38 They shed innocent blood, the blood of their sons and daughters, which they offered to the idols of Canaan, and the land was defiled with blood.
106:39 Thus they were polluted by their actions and went whoring in their evil deeds.
106:40 Therefore the wrath of the Lord was kindled against his people and he abhorred his inheritance.
106:41 He gave them over to the hand of the heathen, and those who hated them ruled over them.
106:42 Their enemies oppressed them, and they were humbled under their hand.
106:43 Many a time did he deliver them, but they rebelled through their own devices, and were brought down in their iniquity.
106:44 Nevertheless, he saw their distress, when he heard their lamentation.
106:45 He remembered his covenant with them and relented in accordance with his great mercy.
106:46 He caused them to be pitied by those who held them captive.
106:47 Save us, O Lord our God, and gather us from among the nations, that we may give thanks to your holy Name and glory in your praise.
106:48 Blessed be the Lord, the God of Israel, from everlasting and to everlasting; and let all the people say, 'Amen!' Hallelujah!

107:1 Give thanks to the Lord, for he is good, and his mercy endures for ever.
107:2 Let all those whom the Lord has redeemed proclaim that he redeemed them from the hand of the foe.
107:3 He gathered them out of the lands; from the east and from the west, from the north and from the south.
107:4 Some wandered in desert wastes; they found no way to a city where they might dwell.
107:5 They were hungry and thirsty; their spirits languished within them.
107:6 Then they cried to the Lord in their trouble, and he delivered them from their distress.
107:7 He put their feet on a straight path to go to a city where they might dwell.
107:8 Let them give thanks to the Lord for his goodness and the wonders he does for his children.
107:9 For he satisfies the thirsty and fills the hungry with good things.
107:10 Some sat in darkness and deep gloom, bound fast in misery and iron;
107:11 Because they rebelled against the words of God and despised the counsel of the Most High.
107:12 So he humbled their spirits with hard labor; they stumbled, and there was none to help.
107:13 Then they cried to the Lord in their trouble, and he delivered them from their distress.
107:14 He led them out of darkness and deep gloom and broke their bonds asunder.
107:15 Let them give thanks to the Lord for his goodness and the wonders he does for his children.
107:16 For he shattered the doors of bronze and broke in two the bars of iron.
107:17 Some were fools and took to rebellious ways; they were afflicted because of their sins.
107:18 They abhorred all manner of food and drew near to death's door.
107:19 Then they cried to the Lord in their trouble, and he delivered them from their distress.
107:20 He sent forth his word and healed them and saved them from the grave.
107:21 Let them give thanks to the Lord for his goodness and the wonders he does for his children.
107:22 Let them offer a sacrifice of thanksgiving and tell of his acts with shouts of joy.
107:23 Some went down to the sea in ships and plied their trade in deep waters;
107:24 They beheld the works of the Lord and his wonders in the deep.
107:25 Then he spoke, and a stormy wind arose, which tossed high the waves of the sea.
107:26 They mounted up to the heavens and fell back to the depths; their hearts melted because of their peril.
107:27 They reeled and staggered like drunkards and were at their wits' end.
107:28 Then they cried to the Lord in their trouble, and he delivered them from their distress.
107:29 He stilled the storm to a whisper and quieted the waves of the sea.
107:30 Then were they glad because of the calm, and he brought them to the harbor they were bound for.
107:31 Let them give thanks to the Lord for his goodness and the wonders he does for his children.
107:32 Let them exalt him in the congregation of the people and praise him in the council of the elders.
107:33 The Lord changed rivers into deserts and water-springs into thirsty ground,
107:34 A fruitful land into salt flats, because of the wickedness of those who dwell there.
107:35 He changed deserts into pools of water and dry land into water-springs.
107:36 He settled the hungry there, and they founded a city to dwell in.
107:37 They sowed fields and planted vineyards, which brought forth a fruitful harvest.
107:38 He blessed them, so that they increased greatly; he did not let their herds decrease.
107:39 Yet when they were diminished and brought low through stress of misfortune and sorrow,
107:40 He pours contempt on princes and makes them wander in trackless wastes.
107:41 But he lifted up the poor out of misery and multiplied their families like flocks of sheep.
107:42 The upright will see this and rejoice, but all wickedness will shut its mouth.
107:43 Whoever is wise will ponder these things and consider well the mercies of the Lord.

108:1 My heart is firmly fixed, O God, my heart is fixed; I will sing and make melody.
108:2 Wake up, my spirit; awake, lute and harp; I myself will waken the dawn.
108:3 I will confess you among the peoples, O Lord; I will sing praises to you among the nations.
108:4 For your loving-kindness is greater than the heavens, and your faithfulness reaches to the clouds.
108:5 Exalt yourself above the heavens, O God, and your glory over all the earth.
108:6 So that those who are dear to you may be delivered, save with your right hand and answer me.
108:7 God spoke from his holy place and said, 'I will exult and parcel out Shechem; I will divide the valley of Succoth.
108:8 Gilead is mine, and Manasseh is mine; Ephraim is my helmet; Judah is my scepter.
108:9 Moab is my washbasin, on Edom I throw down my sandal to claim it, and over Philistia will I shout in triumph.'
108:10 Who will lead me into the strong city? who will bring me into Edom?
108:11 Have you not cast us off, O God? you no longer go out, O God, with our armies.
108:12 Grant us your help against the enemy, for vain is the help of man.
108:13 With God we will do valiant deeds, and he shall tread our enemies under foot.

109:1 Hold not your tongue, O God of my praise; for the mouth of the wicked, the mouth of the deceitful, is opened against me.
109:2 They speak to me with a lying tongue; they encompass me with hateful words and fight against me without a cause.
109:3 Despite my love, they accuse me; but as for me, I pray for them.
109:4 They repay evil for good, and hatred for my love.
109:5 Set a wicked man against him, and let an accuser stand at his right hand.
109:6 When he is judged, let him be found guilty, and let his appeal be in vain.
109:7 Let his days be few, and let another take his office.
109:8 Let his children be fatherless, and his wife become a widow.
109:9 Let his children be waifs and beggars; let them be driven from the ruins of their homes.
109:10 Let the creditor seize everything he has; let strangers plunder his gains.
109:11 Let there be no one to show him kindness, and none to pity his fatherless children.
109:12 Let his descendants be destroyed, and his name be blotted out in the next generation.
109:13 Let the wickedness of his fathers be remembered before the Lord, and the sin of his mother not be blotted out;
109:14 Let their sin be always before the Lord; but let him root out their names from the earth;
109:15 Because he did not remember to show mercy, but persecuted the poor and needy and sought to kill the brokenhearted.
109:16 He loved cursing, let it come upon him; he took no delight in blessing, let it be far from him.
109:17 He put on cursing like a garment, let it soak into his body like water and into his bones like oil;
109:18 Let it be to him like the clothing which covers him and for a belt with which he is girded continually.
109:19 Let this be the reward of my accusers from the Lord, and of those who speak evil against me.
109:20 But you, O Lord my God, oh, deal with me according to your Name; in your great goodness deliver me.
109:21 For I am poor and needy, and my heart is wounded within me.
109:22 I fade away like an evening shadow; I am shaken off like a locust.
109:23 My knees are weak through fasting, and my flesh is wasted and gaunt.
109:24 I have become a reproach to them; they see and shake their heads.
109:25 Help me, O Lord my God; save me for your mercy's sake.
109:26 Let them know that it is your hand, that you, O Lord, have done it.
109:27 They may curse, but you will bless; let those who rise up against me be put to shame, and your servant will rejoice.
109:28 Let my accusers be clothed with disgrace and wrap themselves in their shame as in a cloak.
109:29 I will give great thanks to the Lord with my mouth; in the midst of the multitude will I praise him;
109:30 Because he stands at the right hand of the needy, to save his life from those who would condemn him.

110:1 The Lord said to my Lord, 'Sit at my right hand, until I make your enemies your footstool.'
110:2 The Lord will send the scepter of your power out of Zion, saying, 'Rule over your enemies round about you.
110:3 Princely state has been yours from the day of your birth; in the beauty of holiness have I begotten you, like dew from the womb of the morning.'
110:4 The Lord has sworn and will not recant: 'You are a priest for ever after the order of Melchizedek.'
110:5 The Lord who is at your right hand will smite kings in the day of his wrath.
110:6 He will rule over the nations, heaping up corpses; he will smash heads over the wide earth.
110:7 He will drink from the brook by the way; therefore will he lift up his head.

111:1 Hallelujah! I will give thanks to the Lord with my whole heart, in the assembly of the upright, in the congregation.
111:2 Great are the deeds of the Lord! they are studied by all who delight in them.
111:3 His work is full of majesty and splendor, and his righteousness endures for ever.
111:4 He makes his marvelous works to be remembered; the Lord is gracious and full of compassion.
111:5 He gives food to those who fear him; he is ever mindful of his covenant.
111:6 He has shown his people the power of his works in giving them the heritage of the nations.
111:7 The works of his hands are faithfulness and justice; all his commandments are sure.
111:8 They stand fast for ever and ever, because they are done in truth and equity.
111:9 He sent redemption to his people; he commanded his covenant for ever; holy and awesome is his Name.
111:10 The fear of the Lord is the beginning of wisdom; those who act accordingly have a good understanding; his praise endures for ever.

112:1 Hallelujah! Happy are they who fear the Lord and have great delight in his commandments!
112:2 Their descendants will be mighty in the land; the generation of the upright will be blessed.
112:3 Wealth and riches will be in their house, and their righteousness will last for ever.
112:4 Light shines in the darkness for the upright; the righteous are merciful and full of compassion.
112:5 It is good for them to be generous in lending and to manage their affairs with justice.
112:6 For they will never be shaken; the righteous will be kept in everlasting remembrance.
112:7 They will not be afraid of any evil tidings; their heart is right, they put their trust in the Lord.
112:8 Their heart is established and will not shrink, until they see their desire upon their enemies.

119:1 Happy are they whose way is blameless, who walk in the law of the Lord!
119:2 Happy are they who observe his decrees and seek him with all their hearts!
119:3 Who never do any wrong, but always walk in his ways.
119:4 You laid down your commandments, that we should fully keep them.
119:5 Oh, that my ways were made so direct that I might keep your statutes!
119:6 Then I should not be put to shame, when I regard all your commandments.
119:7 I will thank you with an unfeigned heart, when I have learned your righteous judgments.
119:8 I will keep your statutes; do not utterly forsake me.
119:9 How shall a young man cleanse his way? By keeping to your words.
119:10 With my whole heart I seek you; let me not stray from your commandments.
119:11 I treasure your promise in my heart, that I may not sin against you.
119:12 Blessed are you, O Lord; instruct me in your statutes.
119:13 With my lips will I recite all the judgments of your mouth.
119:14 I have taken greater delight in the way of your decrees than in all manner of riches.
119:15 I will meditate on your commandments and give attention to your ways.
119:16 My delight is in your statutes; I will not forget your word.
119:17 Deal bountifully with your servant, that I may live and keep your word.
119:18 Open my eyes, that I may see the wonders of your law.
119:19 I am a stranger here on earth; do not hide your commandments from me.
119:20 My soul is consumed at all times with longing for your judgments.
119:21 You have rebuked the insolent; cursed are they who stray from your commandments.
119:22 Turn from me shame and rebuke, for I have kept your decrees.
119:23 Even though rulers sit and plot against me, I will meditate on your statutes.
119:24 For your decrees are my delight, and they are my counselors.
119:25 My soul cleaves to the dust; give me life according to your word.
119:26 I have confessed my ways, and you answered me; instruct me in your statutes.
119:27 Make me understand the way of your commandments, that I may meditate on your marvelous works.
119:28 My soul melts away for sorrow; strengthen me according to your word.
119:29 Take from me the way of lying; let me find grace through your law.
119:30 I have chosen the way of faithfulness; I have set your judgments before me.
119:31 I hold fast to your decrees; O Lord, let me not be put to shame.
119:32 I will run the way of your commandments, for you have set my heart at liberty.
119:33 Teach me, O Lord, the way of your statutes, and I shall keep it to the end.
119:34 Give me understanding, and I shall keep your law; I shall keep it with all my heart.
119:35 Make me go in the path of your commandments, for that is my desire.
119:36 Incline my heart to your decrees and not to unjust gain.
119:37 Turn my eyes from watching what is worthless; give me life in your ways.
119:38 Fulfill your promise to your servant, which you make to those who fear you.
119:39 Turn away the reproach which I dread, because your judgments are good.
119:40 Behold, I long for your commandments; in your righteousness preserve my life.
119:41 Let your loving-kindness come to me, O Lord, and your salvation, according to your promise.
119:42 Then shall I have a word for those who taunt me, because I trust in your words.
119:43 Do not take the word of truth out of my mouth, for my hope is in your judgments.
119:44 I shall continue to keep your law; I shall keep it for ever and ever.
119:45 I will walk at liberty, because I study your commandments.
119:46 I will tell of your decrees before kings and will not be ashamed.
119:47 I delight in your commandments, which I have loved.
119:48 I will lift up my hands to your commandments, and I will meditate on your statutes.
119:49 Remember your word to your servant, because you have given me hope.
119:50 This is my comfort in my trouble, that your promise gives me life.
119:51 The proud have derided me cruelly, but I have not turned from your law.
119:52 When I remember your judgments of old, O Lord, I take great comfort.
119:53 I am filled with a burning rage, because of the wicked who forsake your law.
119:54 Your statutes have been like songs to me wherever I have lived as a stranger.
119:55 I remember your Name in the night, O Lord, and dwell upon your law.
119:56 This is how it has been with me, because I have kept your commandments.
119:57 You only are my portion, O Lord; I have promised to keep your words.
119:58 I entreat you with all my heart, be merciful to me according to your promise.
119:59 I have considered my ways and turned my feet toward your decrees.
119:60 I hasten and do not tarry to keep your commandments.
119:61 Though the cords of the wicked entangle me, I do not forget your law.
119:62 At midnight I will rise to give you thanks, because of your righteous judgments.
119:63 I am a companion of all who fear you and of those who keep your commandments.
119:64 The earth, O Lord, is full of your love; instruct me in your statutes.
119:65 O Lord, you have dealt graciously with your servant, according to your word.
119:66 Teach me discernment and knowledge, for I have believed in your commandments.
119:67 Before I was afflicted I went astray, but now I keep your word.
119:68 You are good and you bring forth good; instruct me in your statutes.
119:69 The proud have smeared me with lies, but I will keep your commandments with my whole heart.
119:70 Their heart is gross and fat, but my delight is in your law.
119:71 It is good for me that I have been afflicted, that I might learn your statutes.
119:72 The law of your mouth is dearer to me than thousands in gold and silver.
119:73 Your hands have made me and fashioned me; give me understanding, that I may learn your commandments.
119:74 Those who fear you will be glad when they see me, because I trust in your word.
119:75 I know, O Lord, that your judgments are right and that in faithfulness you have afflicted me.
119:76 Let your loving-kindness be my comfort, as you have promised to your servant.
119:77 Let your compassion come to me, that I may live, for your law is my delight.
119:78 Let the arrogant be put to shame, for they wrong me with lies; but I will meditate on your commandments.
119:79 Let those who fear you turn to me, and also those who know your decrees.
119:80 Let my heart be sound in your statutes, that I may not be put to shame.
119:81 My soul has longed for your salvation; I have put my hope in your word.
119:82 My eyes have failed from watching for your promise, and I say, 'When will you comfort me?'
119:83 I have become like a leather flask in the smoke, but I have not forgotten your statutes.
119:84 How much longer must I wait? when will you give judgment against those who persecute me?
119:85 The arrogant have dug pits for me, contrary to your law.
119:86 All your commandments are true; help me, for they persecute me with lies.
119:87 They had almost made an end of me on earth, but I have not forsaken your commandments.
119:88 In your loving-kindness, revive me, that I may keep the decrees of your mouth.
119:89 O Lord, your word is everlasting; it stands firm in the heavens.
119:90 Your faithfulness remains from one generation to another; you established the earth, and it abides.
119:91 By your decree these continue to this day, for all things are your servants.
119:92 If my delight had not been in your law, I should have perished in my affliction.
119:93 I will never forget your commandments, for by them you give me life.
119:94 I am yours; oh that you would save me! for I study your commandments.
119:95 Though the wicked lie in wait for me to destroy me, I will apply my mind to your decrees.
119:96 I see that all things come to an end, but your commandment has no bounds.
119:97 Oh, how I love your law! all the day long it is in my mind.
119:98 Your commandment has made me wiser than my enemies, and it is always with me.
119:99 I have more understanding than all my teachers, for your decrees are my study.
119:100 I am wiser than the elders, because I observe your commandments.
119:101 I restrain my feet from every evil way, that I may keep your word.
119:102 I do not shrink from your judgments, because you yourself have taught me.
119:103 How sweet are your words to my taste! they are sweeter than honey to my mouth.
119:104 Through your commandments I gain understanding; therefore I hate every lying way.
119:105 Your word is a lantern to my feet and a light upon my path.
119:106 I have sworn and am determined to keep your righteous judgments.
119:107 I am deeply troubled; preserve my life, O Lord, according to your word.
119:108 Accept, O Lord, the willing tribute of my lips, and teach me your judgments.
119:109 My life is always in my hand, yet I do not forget your law.
119:110 The wicked have set a trap for me, but I have not strayed from your commandments.
119:111 Your decrees are my inheritance for ever; truly, they are the joy of my heart.
119:112 I have applied my heart to fulfill your statutes for ever and to the end.
119:113 I hate those who have a divided heart, but your law do I love.
119:114 You are my refuge and shield; my hope is in your word.
119:115 Away from me, you wicked! I will keep the commandments of my God.
119:116 Sustain me according to your promise, that I may live, and let me not be disappointed in my hope.
119:117 Hold me up, and I shall be safe, and my delight shall be ever in your statutes.
119:118 You spurn all who stray from your statutes; their deceitfulness is in vain.
119:119 In your sight all the wicked of the earth are but dross; therefore I love your decrees.
119:120 My flesh trembles with dread of you; I am afraid of your judgments.
119:121 I have done what is just and right; do not deliver me to my oppressors.
119:122 Be surety for your servant's good; let not the proud oppress me.
119:123 My eyes have failed from watching for your salvation and for your righteous promise.
119:124 Deal with your servant according to your loving-kindness and teach me your statutes.
119:125 I am your servant; grant me understanding, that I may know your decrees.
119:126 It is time for you to act, O Lord, for they have broken your law.
119:127 Therefore I love your commandments more than gold, more than fine gold.
119:128 Therefore I esteem all your commandments concerning everything to be right, and I hate every false way.
119:129 Your decrees are wonderful; therefore I obey them with all my heart.
119:130 When your word goes forth it gives light; it gives understanding to the simple.
119:131 I open my mouth and pant in longing for your commandments.
119:132 Turn to me and be gracious to me, as you always do to those who love your Name.
119:133 Order my footsteps in your word; let no iniquity have dominion over me.
119:134 Redeem me from those who oppress me, and I will keep your commandments.
119:135 Let your countenance shine upon your servant and teach me your statutes.
119:136 My eyes shed streams of tears, because people do not keep your law.
119:137 You are righteous, O Lord, and upright are your judgments.
119:138 You have issued your decrees with justice and in perfect faithfulness.
119:139 My indignation has consumed me, because my enemies forget your words.
119:140 Your word has been tested to the uttermost, and your servant holds it dear.
119:141 I am small and of little account, yet I do not forget your commandments.
119:142 Your justice is an everlasting justice and your law is the truth.
119:143 Trouble and distress have come upon me, yet your commandments are my delight.
119:144 The righteousness of your decrees is everlasting; grant me understanding, that I may live.
119:145 I call with my whole heart; answer me, O Lord, that I may keep your statutes.
119:146 I call to you; oh, that you would save me! I will keep your decrees.
119:147 Early in the morning I cry out to you, for in your word is my trust.
119:148 My eyes are open in the night watches, that I may meditate upon your promise.
119:149 Hear my voice, O Lord, according to your loving-kindness; according to your judgments, give me life.
119:150 They draw near who in malice persecute me; they are very far from your law.
119:151 You, O Lord, are near at hand, and all your commandments are true.
119:152 Long have I known from your decrees that you have established them for ever.
119:153 Behold my affliction and deliver me, for I do not forget your law.
119:154 Plead my cause and redeem me; according to your promise, give me life.
119:155 Deliverance is far from the wicked, for they do not study your statutes.
119:156 Great is your compassion, O Lord; preserve my life, according to your judgments.
119:157 There are many who persecute and oppress me, yet I have not swerved from your decrees.
119:158 I look with loathing at the faithless, for they have not kept your word.
119:159 See how I love your commandments! O Lord, in your mercy, preserve me.
119:160 The heart of your word is truth; all your righteous judgments endure for evermore.
119:161 Rulers have persecuted me without a cause, but my heart stands in awe of your word.
119:162 I am as glad because of your promise as one who finds great spoils.
119:163 As for lies, I hate and abhor them, but I love your law.
119:164 Seven times a day do I praise you, because of your righteous judgments.
119:165 Great peace have they who love your law; for them there is no stumbling block.
119:166 I have hoped for your salvation, O Lord, and I have fulfilled your commandments.
119:167 I have kept your decrees and I love them very much.
119:168 I have kept your commandments and decrees, for all my ways are before you.
119:169 Let my cry come before you, O Lord; give me understanding, according to your word.
119:170 Let my supplication come before you; deliver me, according to your promise.
119:171 My lips shall pour forth your praise, when you teach me your statutes.
119:172 My tongue shall sing of your promise, for all your commandments are righteous.
119:173 Let your hand be ready to help me, for I have chosen your commandments.
119:174 I long for your salvation, O Lord, and your law is my delight.
119:175 Let me live, and I will praise you, and let your judgments help me.
119:176 I have gone astray like a sheep that is lost; search for your servant, for I do not forget your commandments.

133:4 It is like the dew of Hermon that falls upon the hills of Zion.
133:5 For there the Lord has ordained the blessing: life for evermore.

135:1 Hallelujah! Praise the Name of the Lord; give praise, you servants of the Lord.
135:2 You who stand in the house of the Lord, in the courts of the house of our God.
135:3 Praise the Lord, for the Lord is good; sing praises to his Name, for it is lovely.
135:4 For the Lord has chosen Jacob for himself and Israel for his own possession.
135:5 For I know that the Lord is great, and that our Lord is above all gods.
135:6 The Lord does whatever pleases him, in heaven and on earth, in the seas and all the deeps.
135:7 He brings up rain clouds from the ends of the earth; he sends out lightning with the rain and brings the winds out of his treasury.
135:8 It was he who struck down the firstborn of Egypt, the firstborn both of man and beast.
135:9 He sent signs and wonders into the midst of you, O Egypt, against Pharaoh and all his servants.
135:10 He overthrew many nations and slaughtered mighty kings:
135:11 Sihon, king of the Amorites, and Og, the king of Bashan, and all the kingdoms of Canaan.
135:12 He gave their land as an inheritance, an inheritance for Israel his people.
135:13 Your Name, O Lord, endures for ever; your renown, O Lord, throughout all ages.
135:14 For the Lord gives his people justice and shows compassion to his servants.
135:15 The idols of the heathen are silver and gold, the work of human hands.
135:16 They have mouths, but they cannot speak; eyes have they, but they cannot see.
135:17 They have ears, but they cannot hear; neither is there any breath in their mouth.
135:18 Those who make them are like them, and so are all who put their trust in them.
135:19 Bless the Lord, O house of Israel; bless the Lord, O house of Aaron.
135:20 Bless the Lord, O house of Levi; you who fear the Lord, bless the Lord.
135:21 Blessed be the Lord out of Zion, who dwells in Jerusalem. Hallelujah!

137:1 By the waters of Babylon we sat down and wept, far from the pleasant land,
137:2 Where we hung our harps upon the trees in the midst of that land.
137:3 For those who led us away captive asked us for a song, and our oppressors called for mirth: 'Sing us one of the songs of Zion.'
137:4 How shall we sing the Lord's song upon an alien soil?
137:5 If I forget you, O Jerusalem, let my right hand forget its skill.
137:6 Let my tongue cleave to the roof of my mouth if I do not remember you, if I do not set Jerusalem above my highest joy.
137:7 Remember the day of Jerusalem, O Lord, against the people of Edom, who said, 'Down with it! down with it! even to the ground!'
137:8 O Daughter of Babylon, doomed to destruction, happy the one who pays you back for what you have done to us!
137:9 Happy shall he be who takes your little ones and dashes them against the rock!

138:1 I will give thanks to you, O Lord, with my whole heart; before the gods I will sing your praise.
138:2 I will bow down toward your holy temple and praise your Name, because of your love and faithfulness;
138:3 For you have glorified your Name and your word above all things.
138:4 When I called, you answered me; you increased my strength within me.
138:5 All the kings of the earth will praise you, O Lord, when they have heard the words of your mouth.
138:6 They will sing of the ways of the Lord, that great is the glory of the Lord.
138:7 Though the Lord be high, he cares for the lowly; he perceives the haughty from afar.
138:8 Though I walk in the midst of trouble, you keep me safe; you stretch forth your hand against the fury of my enemies; your right hand shall save me.
138:9 The Lord will make good his purpose for me; O Lord, your love endures for ever; do not abandon the works of your hands.

139:1 Lord, you have searched me out and known me; you know my sitting down and my rising up; you discern my thoughts from afar.
139:2 You trace my journeys and my resting-places and are acquainted with all my ways.
139:3 Indeed, there is not a word on my tongue, but you, O Lord, know it altogether.
139:4 You encompass me behind and before and lay your hand upon me.
139:5 Such knowledge is too wonderful for me; it is so high that I cannot attain to it.
139:6 Where can I go then from your Spirit? where can I flee from your presence?
139:7 If I climb up to heaven, you are there; if I make the grave my bed, you are there also.
139:8 If I take the wings of the morning and dwell in the uttermost parts of the sea,
139:9 Even there your hand will lead me and your right hand hold me fast.
139:10 If I say, 'Surely the darkness will cover me, and the light around me turn to night,'
139:11 Darkness is not dark to you; the night is as bright as the day; darkness and light to you are both alike.
139:12 For you yourself created my inmost parts; you knit me together in my mother's womb.
139:13 I will thank you because I am marvelously made; your works are wonderful and I know it well.
139:14 My body was not hidden from you, while I was being made in secret and woven in the depths of the earth.
139:15 Your eyes beheld my limbs, yet unfinished in the womb; all of them were written in your book; they were fashioned day by day, when as yet there was none of them.
139:16 How deep I find your thoughts, O God! how great is the sum of them!
139:17 If I were to count them, they would be more in number than the sand; to count them all, my life span must need be like yours.
139:18 Oh, that you would slay the wicked, O God! You that thirst for blood, depart from me.
139:19 They speak despitefully against you; your enemies take your Name in vain.
139:20 Do I not hate those, O Lord, who hate you? and do I not loathe those who rise up against you?
139:21 I hate them with a perfect hatred; they have become my own enemies.
139:22 Search me out, O God, and know my heart; try me and know my restless thoughts.
139:23 Look well whether there be any wickedness in me and lead me in the way that is everlasting.

140:1 Deliver me, O Lord, from evildoers; protect me from the violent,
140:2 Who devise evil in their hearts and stir up strife all day long.
140:3 They have sharpened their tongues like a serpent; adders' poison is under their lips.
140:4 Keep me, O Lord, from the hands of the wicked; protect me from the violent, who are determined to trip me up.
140:5 The proud have hidden a snare for me and stretched out a net of cords; they have set traps for me along the path.
140:6 I have said to the Lord, 'You are my God; listen, O Lord, to my supplication.'
140:7 O Lord God, my strong deliverer, you have covered my head in the day of battle.
140:8 Do not grant the desires of the wicked, O Lord, nor let their evil plans prosper.
140:9 Let not those who surround me lift up their heads; let the evil of their own lips overwhelm them.
140:10 Let hot burning coals fall upon them; let them be cast into the fire, into deep pits from which they shall never rise.
140:11 A slanderer shall not be established on the earth, and evil shall hunt down the violent to overthrow them.
140:12 I know that the Lord will maintain the cause of the poor and render justice to the needy.
140:13 Surely the righteous will give thanks to your Name, and the upright shall continue in your sight.

141:1 O Lord, I call to you; come to me quickly; hear my voice when I cry to you.
141:2 Let my prayer be set forth in your sight as incense, the lifting up of my hands as the evening sacrifice.
141:3 Set a watch before my mouth, O Lord, and guard the door of my lips;
141:4 Let not my heart incline to any evil thing; let me not be occupied in wickedness with evildoers.
141:5 But my eyes are turned to you, Lord God; in you I take refuge; do not strip me of my life.
141:6 Guard me from the trap that they have laid for me and from the snares of evildoers.
141:7 Let the wicked fall into their own nets, while I pass by in safety.

142:1 I cry to the Lord with my voice; to the Lord I make loud supplication.
142:2 I pour out my complaint before him and tell him all my trouble.
142:3 When my spirit languishes within me, you know my path; in the way wherein I walk they have hidden a trap for me.
142:4 I look to my right hand and find no one who knows me; I have no place to flee to, and no one cares for my life.
142:5 I cry out to you, O Lord; I say, 'You are my refuge, my portion in the land of the living.'
142:6 Listen to my cry for help, for I have been brought very low; save me from those who pursue me, for they are too strong for me.
142:7 Bring me out of prison, that I may give thanks to your Name; when you have dealt bountifully with me, the righteous will gather around me.

143:1 Lord, hear my prayer, and in your faithfulness heed my supplications; answer me in your righteousness.
143:2 Enter not into judgment with your servant, for in your sight shall no one living be justified.
143:3 For my enemy has sought my life; he has crushed me to the ground; he has made me live in dark places like those who are long dead.
143:4 My spirit faints within me; my heart within me is desolate.
143:5 I remember the time past; I muse upon all your deeds; I consider the works of your hands.
143:6 I spread out my hands to you; my soul gasps to you like a thirsty land.
143:7 O Lord, make haste to answer me; my spirit fails me; do not hide your face from me or I shall be like those who go down to the Pit.
143:8 Let me hear of your loving-kindness in the morning; for I put my trust in you; show me the road that I must walk, for I lift up my soul to you.
143:9 Deliver me from my enemies, O Lord, for I flee to you for refuge.
143:10 Teach me to do what pleases you, for you are my God; let your good Spirit lead me on level ground.
143:11 Revive me, O Lord, for your Name's sake; for your righteousness' sake, bring me out of trouble.
143:12 Of your goodness, destroy my enemies and bring all my foes to naught, for truly I am your servant.

144:1 Blessed be the Lord my rock, who trains my hands for battle and my fingers for warfare;
144:2 My help and my fortress, my stronghold and my deliverer, my shield in whom I trust, who subdues the peoples under me.
144:3 O Lord, what are mortals that you should care for them? mere humans that you should think of them?
144:4 We are like a puff of wind; our days are like a passing shadow.
144:5 Bow your heavens, O Lord, and come down; touch the mountains, and they shall smoke.
144:6 Hurl the lightning and scatter them; shoot out your arrows and rout them.
144:7 Stretch out your hand from on high; deliver me and snatch me from the great waters, from the hand of foreign peoples,
144:8 Whose mouths speak deceitfully and whose right hand is raised in falsehood.
144:9 I will sing a new song to you, O God; on a ten-stringed lyre I will play to you.
144:10 You give victory to kings and have rescued David your servant.
144:11 Rescue me from the hurtful sword and deliver me from the hand of foreign peoples,
144:12 Whose mouths speak deceitfully and whose right hand is raised in falsehood.
144:13 May our sons be like plants well-nurtured from their youth, and our daughters like pillars carved for the corners of a palace.
144:14 May our barns be filled to overflowing with all manner of crops; may the flocks in our pastures increase by thousands and tens of thousands; may our cattle be fat and sleek.
144:15 May there be no breaching of the walls, no going into exile, no wailing in the streets of our city.
144:16 Happy are the people of whom this is so! happy are the people whose God is the Lord!

145:1 I will exalt you, O God my King, and bless your Name for ever and ever.
145:2 Every day will I bless you and praise your Name for ever and ever.
145:3 Great is the Lord and greatly to be praised; there is no end to his greatness.
145:4 One generation shall praise your works to another and shall declare your power.
145:5 I will ponder the glorious splendor of your majesty and all your marvelous works.
145:6 They shall speak of the might of your wondrous acts, and I will tell of your greatness.
145:7 They shall publish the remembrance of your great goodness; they shall sing of your righteous deeds.
145:8 The Lord is gracious and full of compassion, slow to anger and of great kindness.
145:9 The Lord is loving to everyone, and his compassion is over all his works.
145:10 All your works praise you, O Lord, and your faithful servants bless you.
145:11 They make known the glory of your kingdom and speak of your power;
145:12 That the peoples may know of your power and the glorious splendor of your kingdom.
145:13 Your kingdom is an everlasting kingdom; your dominion endures throughout all ages.
145:14 The Lord is faithful in all his words and merciful in all his deeds.
145:15 The Lord upholds all those who fall; he lifts up those who are bowed down.
145:16 The eyes of all wait upon you, O Lord, and you give them their food in due season.
145:17 You open wide your hand and satisfy the needs of every living creature.
145:18 The Lord is righteous in all his ways and loving in all his works.
145:19 The Lord is near to all who call upon him, to all who call upon him faithfully.
145:20 He fulfills the desire of those who fear him; he hears their cry and helps them.
145:21 The Lord preserves all those who love him, but he destroys all the wicked.
145:22 My mouth shall speak the praise of the Lord; let all flesh bless his holy Name for ever and ever.

147:1 Hallelujah! How good it is to sing praises to our God! how pleasant it is to honor him with praise!
147:2 The Lord rebuilds Jerusalem; he gathers the exiles of Israel.
147:3 He heals the brokenhearted and binds up their wounds.
147:4 He counts the number of the stars and calls them all by their names.
147:5 Great is our Lord and mighty in power; there is no limit to his wisdom.
147:6 The Lord lifts up the lowly, but casts the wicked to the ground.
147:7 Sing to the Lord with thanksgiving; make music to our God upon the harp.
147:8 He covers the heavens with clouds and prepares rain for the earth;
147:9 He makes grass to grow upon the mountains and green plants to serve mankind.
147:10 He provides food for flocks and herds and for the young ravens when they cry.
147:11 He is not impressed by the might of a horse, he has no pleasure in the strength of a man;
147:12 But the Lord has pleasure in those who fear him, in those who await his gracious favor.
147:13 Worship the Lord, O Jerusalem; praise your God, O Zion;
147:14 For he has strengthened the bars of your gates; he has blessed your children within you.
147:15 He has established peace on your borders; he fills you with the finest wheat.
147:16 He sends out his command to the earth, and his word runs very swiftly.
147:17 He gives snow like wool; he scatters hoarfrost like ashes.
147:18 He scatters his hail like bread crumbs; who can stand against his cold?
147:19 He sends forth his word and melts them; he blows with his wind, and the waters flow.
147:20 He declares his word to Jacob, his statutes and his judgments to Israel.
147:21 He has not done so to any other nation; to them he has not revealed his judgments. Hallelujah!

150:1 Hallelujah! Praise God in his holy temple; praise him in the firmament of his power.
150:2 Praise him for his mighty acts; praise him for his excellent greatness.
150:3 Praise him with the blast of the ram's-horn; praise him with lyre and harp.
150:4 Praise him with timbrel and dance; praise him with strings and pipe.
150:5 Praise him with resounding cymbals; praise him with loud-clanging cymbals.
150:6 Let everything that has breath praise the Lord. Hallelujah!

text.Orthodox:
151:1 I was small among my brethren, and the youngest in the house of my father; I did shepherd the sheep of my father.
151:2 My hands made an instrument, and my fingers fashioned a lyre.
151:3 And who will tell my Lord? The Lord himself, it is he who hears.
151:4 It was he who sent his messenger and took me from the sheep of my father, and anointed me with his anointing oil.
151:5 My brothers were handsome and tall, but the Lord was not pleased with them.
151:6 I went out to meet the Philistine, and he cursed me by his idols.
151:7 But I drew his own sword; I beheaded him, and removed reproach from the people of Israel.

152:1 With a loud voice glorify ye God; in the assembly of many proclaim ye His glory.
152:2 Amid the multitude of the upright glorify His praise; and speak of His glory with the faithful.
152:3 Be united with the good and with the perfect to glorify the Most High.
152:4 Gather yourselves together to make known His salvation; and be not slow in showing forth His strength and His majesty to all the simple.
152:5 That the honor of the Lord may be known, wisdom hath been given; and to tell of His works it was made known to men: to declare to the simple His righteousness, to make the ignorant understand His greatness; to set before the humble the knowledge of His majesty.
152:6 Draw nigh then, ye that fear the Lord, and hear His word.
152:7 Receive the wisdom of the Lord, and walk in it, and walk not in the way of unrighteousness.
152:8 Let him that feareth God receive doctrine, and they that can understand obtain it.
152:9 Let him that is willing be obedient to the commandments, and they that are well-pleasing to Him shall find everlasting life.

153:1 O Lord, I have cried unto Thee; hearken Thou unto me.
153:2 I have lifted up my hands to Thy holy dwelling-place; incline Thine ear unto me.
153:3 Grant me my request; withhold not from me my petition.
153:4 Build up my soul, and destroy it not; and lay it not bare before the wicked.
153:5 May the judge of truth turn away from me the rewards of evil, O Lord.
153:6 O Lord, judge me not in Thy wrath, neither chasten me in Thine anger.
153:7 For Thy chastening is upon all, O Lord, and Thy judgment is just.
153:8 Cleanse me, O Lord, from all sin, and save me from all evil.
153:9 For Thine is the kingdom, and the power, and the glory, for ever. Amen.

154:1 Praise the Lord, all ye nations; glorify Him, and bless His name.
154:2 Who rescued the soul of His elect from the hands of death, and delivered His holy one from destruction.
154:3 And saved me from the nets of Sheol, and from the pit that cannot be fathomed.
154:4 Because, ere my deliverance could go forth from before Him, I was well nigh torn in two pieces by two wild beasts.
154:5 But He sent His angel, and shut up from me the gaping mouths, and rescued my life from destruction.
154:6 My soul shall glorify Him and exalt Him, because of all His kindnesses, which He has done and will do unto me.
